dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASSIDY sits at the bar with a glass of beer, packet of Camels in front of him beside his change, one lit in his hand. Bar noises behind him - jukebox music, conversation Occasional glimpse of people passing by behind him. Smoky atmosphere. We stay on him as he knocks back the beer, se down the empty glass, smiles wryly.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Piss. And not enough of it. The BARMAN picks up the glass. Cassidy draws on his cigarette, sits back. He’ll now tell us the story as if w were sitting at the bar beside him, so he won't always be looking right at us.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: So where was I? Oh aye, the Preacher. Well, before I get stuck into this you'd better get it straight that this is no ordinary story. Ordinary story is boy meets girl, boy gets girl up the stick, father forbids boy to see girl but true love wins through, audience pukes its ring, the end. Or maybe bad guys kill helpless innocents, head bad guy with English accent prepares to take over the world, Arnie Schwarzennegger kills everybody in sight, girl shows us her tits, everything blows up, the end... The barman sets down a fresh beer. Cassidy is pleased.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: But this one's different. Just about as different as you can fucking get, to tell you the truth. Jesus, I was smack in the middle of it, and even ft don't believe half the fucking things that went on. There was angels. Demons. Rednecks. Gunslingers from beyond the grave. Fucking vampires, would you believe. There was a boy with a face that looked like your arsehole, and a woman who was braver than any man I ever met, and a man who stood tall in front of Heaven itself and faced down the power of God. He sips his beer, looks thoughtful, smiles a bit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You wouldn't know to look at me, but I'm ninety~seven years old. I thought I'd seen it ali. But you won't have to see too much of this one before you realize what I did: that absolutely fuckin’ anything can happen anytime. That there aren't any rules to this. That you're entering the one hundred percent bugfuck maniac Geoffrey Dahmer's- running-down-Broadway-with-John Wayne Bobbitt 's-dick-in-a-bucket-of-napalm- zone, and any attempt to understand it is gonna make your arse turn inside out. It's a love story. It's a horror story. It's a violent story. He thinks for a moment, trying to find the words. Then he relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: It started in church. 2 EXT. ANNVILLE -— NIGHT Starting from out in the Texas desert, we move slowly in towards the few lights of ANNVILLE. Getting closer, we realize we're in Hicksville, the ass-end of nowhere. A ma street with a few smaller ones off it. We move past a bar just some low light, not much noise. Looking down a side street, we see two DRUNKS supporting each other for the stagger home. Further on, a quick look down an alley reve movement, the sound of breaking glass. A sheriff's dept. cruiser passes us, going in the opposite direction. Movin across the town square we see another DRUNK passed out on bench, with a vile-looking DOG raping his unconscious leg We move slowly towards the church, a simple wooden buildi just outside town, on the opposite side to where we came A light is on within, and as we get closer we hear raised voices, a Man's and a woman's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The church is an old building, as simple within as withou Just rows of pews facing a lectern on a raised platform. Large black cross on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: You're a Preacher? A fucking Preacher? Jesse, I can't fucking believe this! It took me so long to find you, I knew you had to be mixed up in something crazy, but...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Tulip, I know this has gotta be kind of upsetting-

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Yes, I'd say it's pretty fucking kind of upsetting. You walk out on me without a word of warning, you leave me high and dry in Phoenix with twenty-seven dollars to my name, and now after three years of searching the length and breadth of Texas I find you and what are you doing? You're worshipping fucking God!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Aw, now don't say his name like that-

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I'm just a little bit pissed at him at the moment. I'll say his name any way I want. I mean what the fuck is going on here?’ I expected to find you running hash over the border, or running a goddamn strip joint, or that you'd just gone back to the good old G.T.A. I expected to find you banging that skinny slut from Waco, whatsername. But instead you're a Preacher, an honest to fuck man of God, and the only thing you're banging is the Bible! Now what in the name of fuck is that all about?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Honey-

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: And another thing, just exactly how does an ex-car thief qualify for the fucking Ministry anyhow? There's no way you're telling me the church has

dialogues.speaker: TULIP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: fe started embracing the kind of shit that we used to get up to!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It wasn't all that bad-

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: It wasn't? Christ, Jesse, there are people from New Orleans to San Diego still wondering what happened to their fucking Ferraris. The Jesse Custer I remember could hot-wire the Space Shuttle blindfold, used to put bourbon in his coffee because “sugar's for fags", and liked to fuck all day and all night till the sun came up again. Now, I don't recall learning too much of that kind of thing in Sunday School, but if that’s what Christians are into these days then please, tell me: where do I sign up? They look at each other for a moment, Jesse unsure of wha do, Tulip exasperated. Then she calms a little. e@ TULIP Just tell me why.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: .--IT can't.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you can't?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: T mean I can't tell you why I left you to become a Preacher. I made a promise to someone, someone real important to me. I had to do right by ’en.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: {hurt, taken aback) But what about me, Jesse? Didn't you care about doing right by me?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, honey. Of course I did. [I just...I thought you'd get over it, find someone else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were my dream, Jesse. How did you think I was gonna get over you? All that time we spent, running cars into Vegas or Austin or San Antone, and I used to look at you and say, “Re’s really mine.* (pause) And you used to lock at me and say you'd love me until the end of the world.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (miserable) I know. I know. But it can't ever be that way again.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: why not?!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I told you. I made a promise. I never went back on my word to anyone, an' if I was to start doin' it now I figure I wouldn't be worth a good @ goddamn. She stares at him, quietly stunned. He looks back at her, sad but determined. There it is. She puts a hand to her face. Jesse reaches out to her, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: (furious, recoiling) . Get off me! Goddamn it, do you have any idea how much you fucking hurt me?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: , TULIP
dialogues.text: Fuck you! You and your fucking macho bullshit! You throw everything we had down the toilet for some fucking promise to do a job you know is bullshit? Well the hell with you, Jesse Custer. You make such a big deal about how you never lie or go back on your word and oh, no, you never did- @ (vicious) Except to me. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.text: She turns and stomps out, furious, almost tearful. The miserable Jesse can only stand and watch her go. The door slams behind her and Jesse is left alone. He slu back into a pew, as low as he can go, upset and a little angry ~

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Shit. He turns towards the lectern. Below the open Bible on top it is a little shelf, hidden from the view of the congregation. On it are a nearly full bottle of Jack Daniel's, a silver Zippo and several packets of Marlboros

dialogues.text: Jesse sits alone, smoking a Marlboro, taking long, slow p on the bourbon. He's taken his jacket off, loosened his collar. About a dozen cigarette butts lie stubbed out on pew beside him. He has a surly look about him, pissed off the world in general and the shitty hand dealt him by fat He stares resentfully up at the big black cross behind th lectern. He's turned all the lights out except for a litt one on the lectern that illuminates the Bible. Lots of shadows. He raises the bottle again, swigs it. Only half- full now. Jesse drinks bourbon the way normal people drin water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashback. A slightly YOUNGER JESSE, wearing black T-shir and jeans, strides confidently through a crowded bar with pretty, if skinny, dark-haired GIRL on his arm. The place jumping, dark and smoky, a rough crowd getting good and drunk. Light comes mostly from neon beer signs. As he passes us, a face in the background swims into focus: the YOUNGER TULIP, seeing him for the first time, liking what sees. Jesse leans back against the bar, sticks a cigarette in h mouth, surveys the bar with mild interest as his girlfrie searches her purse for a lighter. To Jesse's slight surprise, a woman's hand comes into view from his other s lighting his cigarette with a silver Zippo. By the time h girlfriend has come up with her own lighter, it's too lat The girl turns, startled to see Jesse staring into Tulip' eyes as she closes the Zippo, smiling knowingly back at h ging. Instant connection.  10 11 12

dialogues.text: The younger Jesse and Tulip. He's driving, grinning, enjoying her attention as she laughs in delight. A quick glimpse of the cruiser disappearing in the dust behind th as she leans over to him and they kiss, smiling all the while.

CHURCH - NIGHT il Another swig. Barely any whiskey left. He locks miserable for a moment, saddened.

dialogues.text: Jesse raises his head, and we see that anger is replacing sadness as he stares up at the cross, bitter and resentfu He gets angrier with each passing second. His lip curls i a snarl as he stands and flings the empty bottle with all might. It shatters into a million pieces against the cros The sound seems huge in the enclosed space - ‘then it fad

dialogues.text: Jesse lies across one of the pews, asleep in his clothes. Bright light floods in through the windows. He slowly rai his head, bleary~eyed. Not looking too good. Hair tousled unshaven, red eyes, clothes dishevelled. He grimaces as t hangover makes itself known. Slowly he becomes aware of t engine noises outside. Then he freaks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Oh, fuck!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Mornin'!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: +..and that's what Jesus was trying to tell us when he did these things: that God, his Father in Heaven, will forgive us our sins no matter what they might he... Jesse really isn't looking well. The hangover's kicking i but good. He's sweating. He runs a hand through his hair, blinks a lot to try to concentrate.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: But we have to ask him for that forgiveness. His congregation is not particularly inspiring material. Maybe 20-25 people, all staring dully back at him or at t floor, bored. KIDS look out the windows. A couple of FAT GUYS, a STRINGY-LOOKING WOMAN, an OLDER GUY WITH NO CHIN, FAT KID picking his nose.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: And we have to mean it when we ask, or his forgiveness is rendered pointless. We can't expect to sin and be forgiven all throughout our lives. God can forgive us our sins - but it's up to us to accept his forgiveness and his love, and live from that point on without sin, as best as we are able... Jesse stifles a belch, swallows hard, sweats, tries to sm and look like a guy who's got the inside scoop.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What we can't do is come to church every Sunday an‘ say a few quick prayers, and then sin as much as we darn well want for the rest of the week. As he continues, we focus on one of the fat guys in the congregation again ~ he's asleep. Then a BORED TEENAGE BO looking down his SISTER'S cleavage. Then the nose-picking kid, and the huge booger he’s hauling out of his nostril. Jesse's voice begins to falter.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: That ain't the way it works, folks. The Lord wants a commitment from us...and... : (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: And, uh...he wants a promise of faith... The nose-picking kid's booger slides out of his nose, stu to his finger. It's a biggie, all right, all green and snattery. Jesse's face falls in weary disgust.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Because that's how... He clams up and we see the anger returning to his face. A moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Aw, fuck it! That gets their attention.

dialogues.text: The congregation gapes at Jesse, transfixed.’ He rants at them, red-faced and furious, spitting hate. He's like som evangelist on PCP as he pours out his frustration.

Well fuck you, you hear me? You assholes are doin’ exactly the kind of shit I was

It changes instantly an equally beautiful but demonic, disturbing woman's face also screaming. Then it hits Jesse, no longer in slow motion. Another bur of light, then he's hurled backwards against the cross. T comet disappears. Jesse falls tc the ground in a heap. Th congregation stares, then they turn to each other, bewildered.

The congregation stares, riveted but terrified. Then the smoking and sparking stop, as does the noise. Th figure disappears. Only Jesse is left, hanging there, apparently unconscious.

Their scorched skeletons lie sprawled over the pews or flung back into seated position little fires burning inside the ribcages, flesh burnt cle off the bones. A hellish scene. Tulip advances, shocked, fearful of what's yet to come. S coughs a bit, wafts the smoke aside. She passes the skele of the nose-picking kid, sitting stupidly with a bony fin jammed in its nasal cavity. The she turns to us, catches sight of something, stifles a gasp. Way back in the swirling dust a figure can just be made o weirdly transparent at first, dust whipping through it. T moves towards us all the while, getting more solid as it moves closer. Thus arrives the SAINT OF KILLERS, As he gets closer we can make out details - the flapping duster coat, wide-brimmed hat hiding his face. He strides towards us, then past us, an unstoppable quality to his g as if he’s been going forever and nothing gets in his pat He keeps his head lowered so we never see his face, but w get a glimpse of a holstered pistol, a gnarled hand. The dust howls around him as he passes - then he's gone.  39 17.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: That pick-up seen headin' away from here - none of our eyewitnesses said anything about coloured people...

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Don‘t have to be coloured if they're from Mars, Kenny. You ever read that book Communion?

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Can't say I have, Sheriff Root.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Fella in that knew all about ‘em. ‘Cept he got the wrong idea. (patting the 44 magnum in his belt holster} Only Communion your Martian Nigger understands is the kind I got right here. Deputy Foster shouts from one of the cruisers, where he's We can hear it crackling.

dialogues.speaker: FOSTER
dialogues.text: Sheriff Root, Sheriff Meeker says he's got you the chopper an’ marksman you requested, but he wants you to go talk to some media people -

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: (unfazed) You tell him fuck you. (spitting) You tell him Hugo Root says fuck you. Tell him I want that chopper up here now, an' to keep them media fucks away or I'1l send ‘em back in bodybags .

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Sheriff Root? You figure, maybe, the way these people been blasted to goddamn bones, we oughta wait for some real back-up before we go lookin' for ‘em?

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: We got air support an' snipers an' half a dozen roadblocks bein’ set up right now, Kenny. You ain’t goin’ weak sister on me, are you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: (peeved) All I'm sayin' is it could be more than we can handle here ~

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: It could be I'm gonna take me a big shit tomorrow an' find the keys to Graceland in the bowl, but I kinda doubt that as well. (spitting) Martian Niggers, Kenny. (strolling off) You wait an‘ see, And Kenny is left fuming quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run-down place beside a desert road, no other buildings about. The night is still. Tulip's pick-up is parked at o of the pumps, and she's filling the tank. She finishes, leans over to look at Jesse, anxious. He doesn't look goo at all - sweating, fidgeting in his sleep, face twisting.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: What am I doing with you? (pause) T must need my fucking head examined. She pulls the blanket tighter around him, takes her purse from the driver's seat, heads off to pay. Out on the edge of the gas station, a scruffy-looking guy pads out of the desert night, stops to survey the station Tulip's pick-up catches his eye. It's Cassidy - tired, bu with a sneaky grin on his face.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ deadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulip has piled a first aid kit and several bottles of wa in front ef the bored looking clerk.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: And these too, please. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The clerk grunts. Tulip leoks round, curious, as an engin starts. Out the window, we see her pick-up start to move away.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Fuck! She races out of the office and sprints after the truck a heads for the road, fumbling in her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy is driving, whistling happily to himself. Just as pulls out onto the road Tulip leaps onto the truck, grabb the driver side door and hauling herself up. With her fre hands she sticks the gun we saw earlier in Cassidy's face furious. He's startled.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Pull over! Cassidy stares at her in amazement, keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: I said pull over, asshole! What the fuck do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (laughing in disbelief) What the fuck does it look like I'm doin‘? I'm stealin' your pick-up truck! .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck picks up speed, racing past us with Tulip hangi off the side. Up ahead there's a rise in the road with so low hiils beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy can't believe this, finds it hilarious. This make Tulip even angrier.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch! Stop the truck and get out! Now! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Bollocks to that, love. I've been walkin’ across that desert for three nights now. I'm not fuckin’ stoppin' for anyone.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: {cocking the gun} I fucking mean it. In the back of the truck, Jesse is being bounced around a over the place. He wakes slowly, still woozy.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Huh...? Cassidy is actually looking a bit concerned now, but not himself. Tulip is ready to shoot.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Will you for fuck's sake get rid of that thing an' I'll stop an’ let you off. You're only gonna hurt yourself, you know.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: What I'm gonna do is blow your head clean out the fucking windshield if you don’t stop the truck in three seconds time. Three. Two. Cassidy faces front, freaks.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Jesus fuckin' Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the truck comes over the rise in the road it screeches a halt in a huge broadside skid. Twenty yards ahead is Hu Root's roadblock. Two cruisers have been parked in the ro with just enough space for a car to slip between them, an then only by turning sharply. Powerful lights flood the p up. Eight DEPUTIES man the roadblock, reacting immediatel to the pick-up’s arrival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy is damn near flung through the windshield by the emergency stop, and Tulip barely keeps a grip, dropping t gun on the truck seat. Her legs are flung out behind her.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In the back, Jesse's head bangs hard into the wall of the cab. He slams a hand to the injured area, agonized, furio

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sooner has the truck stopped moving than a sheriff's d helicopter roars up over the hill from behind the roadblo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the pilot a MARKSMAN takes aim with a mean looking scope rifle at the pick-up truck below. He wears a radio headset, over which we hear the crackle of static.

dialogues.speaker: MARKSMAN
dialogues.text: Sheriff Root, I have ‘em locked. Repeat, I got a lock on them, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, DESERT ROAD
dialogues.text: The deputies take cover behind the cars, taking aim with variety of handguns, pump shotguns and Ml6s. Standing in middle, revolver in one hand, bullhorn in the other, is H Root. Kenny and Foster are at his side.

dialogues.speaker: MARKSMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (over radio) Just say the word.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: {over bullhorn) You fucks exit the truck with your hands in the air or you will be fired upon. Do it now or we open fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy and Tulip stare out at the cops, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Oh no...!

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Shite. You know, I could really do without this at the minute...  52 53

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marksman opens fire even as Hugo speaks, three quick shots.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO, (0.8)
dialogues.text: (over radio) Wake ‘em up in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy and Tulip recoil in shock as the bullets punch through the hood barely a foot in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Fuckin' Jesus! They exit the truck fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy and Tulip get out of the truck, hands high. As th helicopter passes overhead, Jesse can be seen in the back the truck, still holding his head.

dialogues.speaker: MARKSMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: {over radio) You got a third subject in the back, Sheriff Root. One more guy. Hugo shouts again. His deputies are squinting down their gunsights, taking no chances.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: (over bullhorn) You in the back, we ain't gonna warn you again. Get your ass outta there. Jesse sits up, rubbing his head. He notices Tulip, then Cassidy, both standing with their hands raised. He frowns Cassidy's bewildered at his sudden appearance. Tulip is a loss...

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Christ!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Who the fuck's he? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: {over pullhorn) Put your hands on the truck an’ spread your legs. Make any other attempt to move an' I guarantee it: you're fucked. Hugo puts the bullhorn down, relaxes a bit. Kenny doesn't seem SO confident. A couple of deputies move forward, the rest stay put.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: (spitting) We got these sons of bitches. The helicopter makes a low pass on our heroes, now leanin against the truck as per Hugo's instructions. Jesse rubs head, grimacing angrily.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: This is like a night out with fuckin’ O.d...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Tulip, what the fuck is goin' on here?

dialogues.speaker: HUGO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: {over bullhorn) You in the suit: both hands on the truck, I said.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (fuming) FUCK THIS. He turns towards the roadblock, grim as hell, lowering hi arms. Tulip gasps.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Jesse, stop! They'll kill you! Hugo snarls again. Lots of clicks as his men cock their guns.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: {over bullhorn) Hold it right there, Mister. You put your hands on that truck or we will lawfully blow your ass all over this goddamned highway. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse raises his head, glares at us. He looks like he rea means business. When he speaks, everything else goes utte silent. There's a weird, deep echo to his voice, This is the WORD OF GOD, the power he's gotten from Genesis.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (word of God) Drop the guns. All of you. And let us go. The deputies freeze. So does Hugo. Their faces go blank. moment passes. Then they start dropping their guns on the ground. A loud clatter as the various firearms hit the de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marksman, equally blank-faced, drops his rifle out th side of the ’copter. The sound of the rotors can be heard beating faintly, as if far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marksman's rifle lands on deputy Foster's head, dropp him instantly. Hugo is right beside him but can only blin confused. Jesse turns to the astonished Tulip and Cassidy quietly determined.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I think we oughta be leavin’. They stare at him for a second, then snap out’ of it.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I'm with you, mate.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Just a fucking second} This guy was gonna steal my truck! Jesse's eyes narrow as he turns to Cassidy, who grins disarmingly.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Aye, but I can explain that. Just give us a lift down the road, will you? I’d really appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Like hell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse studies Cassidy carefully. Cassidy meets his gaze without being hostile. They're sizing each other up.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (nodding slightly) Get in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Aw, nice one!

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Have you gone out of your fucking mind? Jesse looks ready to speak, then freezes. His eyes narrow intense, bewildered concentration. We close up on his fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A three-second flash of images - blazing flames - an ange face, screaming - a demonic face, roaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's face twists in confusion. Then he snaps out of it looks at Tulip.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I ain't about to leave anyone to get fucked up by these assholes. We can talk about it later. Okay? Tulip glances at the cops, fumes, wrenches open the door. Jesse gets in, she follows. Cassidy's already gotten in t passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look past someone‘s leg and flapping duster coat at th distant lights of the roadblock. The Saint has arrived.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, DESERT ROAD
dialogues.text: Tulip starts the engine, moves off. Hugo and his deputies snap out of it as the truck speeds through their roadbloc narrowly missing a couple of the cruisers. They're amazed (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Pick up your fuckin’ guns, you assholes! They do, but by then the truck has raced away. General confusion. Deputy Foster gets shakily to his feet, poking his bleeding scalp. Hugo, having retrieved his pistol, is furious.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: You bunch of goddamned, by-the-Jesus, stupid, cocksuckin’ faggots - you stood there an' let those bastards drive away ~

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: {amazed) So did you! One of the deputies on the edge of the group turns toward us, eyes narrowing.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Sheriff Root? @ Hugo yanks open the door of the nearest cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Well come on, for Jesus' sake! Get after them! You there, you get that chopper on the horn -

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: (shouting) Sheriff Root! Everyone turns, Hugo included. The Deputy, rather shaken, points out into the desert. About thirty yards from the roadblock stands the Saint of Killers. Not too much detai visible on him yet. The deputies watch, not sure of what make of him. Kenny's eyes narrow, cautious. He's standing slightly in front of Hugo. Hugo slams the door shut, glar at us.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Well, well, well. The Saint is unmoved, coat flapping a little in the breez head lowered slightly so the brim of his hat hides most o his face. Hugo puts a hand to his holstered pistol. His i. deputies bring up their weapons, not taking their eyes the Saint. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Whe the fuck have we got here? No answer comes. Hugo locks annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: You look to me like you might be trouble, Mister. The Saint doesn't move. His voice isn't much more than a slow whisper, but it sounds terribly grim, full of restra threat.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: Yeah. The Saint raises his head, slow and deliberate. His eyes cold and hard, promising nothing but death. Utterly riveting, terrifying. His lip curls slightly. He speaks through his teeth, unimpressed by what he sees, a hint of disdain in his voice. To him this is just an inconvenienc not worth getting angry or peeved over. He does everythin slowly, gradually. He has no need to rush.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: An' you don't look to me like the man who'll stop it. The deputies are suddenly unaccountably scared, looking warily at one another. Hugo grimaces, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Is that a fact...

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: Sheriff Root -

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Who the fuck does this asshole think he is? You boys get ready, now... The Saint pushes his coat back to reveal his holstered pistols. He doesn't pose with his hands over them, or any Hollywood gunfighter bullshit. He acts like he has all th time in the world.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: (scared) : Sheriff Root, for God's sake! Look at him!

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: (snarling) Fuck you, Kenny. The minute he goes for them pistols, you open f- The Saint's hands blur to his holsters and come up with t black iron Walker Colt revolvers. Two massive roaring bla fill the air, flame shoots from the muzzles, smoke belche back. Deputy Foster's large gut explodes in a welter of gore. Kenny barely registers this as his shoulder erupts in a s ef blood and his entire arm is blown off. The arm cartwheels past Hugo in slow motion, still holdin Kenny's pistol, blood jetting everywhere. Hugo gasps as blood from the arm sprays into his face. The Saint steps towards the terrified deputies, cocks his pistols, fires again. He aims casually as he moves forwar at a stroll. The others bring up their guns and open fire. Multiple shots, automatic and shotgun fire. Two of them are flung packwards by the Saint's bullets, torn bloodily open.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch -

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY 2
dialogues.text: Drop him! Bullets and slugs smash into the Saint, staggering him slightly. One smashes into his face, turning his head. He turns back, grimacing, clearly not pleased. There's a hole in his face and several more in his chest, but no bl comes out. It's.like dead meat underneath. The deputies gape in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Aw no. The Saint cocks his pistols as he advances, now barely ya from the parked cruisers. One guy breaks and runs. Anothe sinks behind the car, cowering in terror. The other two resume firing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Saint takes more hits, but isn't worried. He walks towards Kenny, who lies on the ground in deep shock, ruin shoulder pumping blood into a widening pool on the road. The shooting continues as the Saint's shadow falls across Kenny, who opens his eyes. He dies a rather pissed-off ma

dialogues.speaker: KENNY
dialogues.text: (whispers) Fuck you, Sheriff Root. The Saint doesn't bother to aim, just pulls the trigger a walks past Kenny. Another blast. He brings up the second pistol as more bullets smash into him, fires. A deputy’s head is blown completely apart. The one cowering behind the cruiser is blubbering pathetically, back jammed against the side of the car. Th last guy, still shooting, yells desperately at the coward guy.

dialogues.speaker: SCARED DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus Christ please save me now, I fuckin' beg you! Don't let me die here! Don't let me die!

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake shoot back at him, you stupid son of a bitch! The Saint takes careful aim, fires once. The bullet punches through the side panel of the cruiser, just over the front wheel, with a metallic clang. On the other side, the scared deputy gapes in amazement a the bullet tears out of his chest in a shower of blood an meat. The deputy beside him ceases fire, turning to stare. Beyo him, about fifty yards down the road, we see the deputy w proke and ran earlier. Another rearing gunshot and the nearer deputy loses the f of his head. Beyond him, about a second later, the runnin deputy throws up his arms and falls.  60 61 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse turns to stare out the back window, bewildered. The lights of the firefight and the roadblock can be seen reflected in the glass.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Tulip, will you pull over for a second?

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Will I what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugo Root kneels at the end of the carnage, furious, tryi to wipe the blood out of his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: What the fuck is goin' on? Puck! Sons of fuckin’ whores - He clears his eyes, looks up, blinking, realizes the Sain legs are about three feet away. The Saint watches calmly, pistols held at his sides. He's been shot about a dozen times, but the wounds seem like nothing more than cuts or bad bruises. He's not so angry now, back to the slow-burning disdain. Hugo stands up, slow, holding his hands up open and empty He's not so much scared as very, very cautious, His pisto is gone from its holster.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Now...you can see I ain't armed... The Saint raises one of the pistols, points it right at u The muzzle is a yawning black chasm.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: Reckon you can see IT am. Hugo closes his eyes, sweating buckets. Weary, disgusted fear shows at last on his face. Then: multiple gunshots, and the Saint is rocked by the impact of several bullets. The sound of the helicopter rotors come back.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The helicopter roars back into place over the shattered roadblock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marksman has an automatic pistol dead-aimed with both hands, yelling into his radio headset.

dialogues.speaker: MARKSMAN
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) Sheriff Root, runt Get the fuck outta there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saint turns to look up at the ‘copter, not too impres Behind him, Hugo snaps out of it and runs like hell. The ‘copter hovers barely twenty yards over the cars and scattered bodies, the Saint turning towards it. The marks can clearly be seen, locked on target.

dialogues.speaker: MARKSMAN
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) You! Drop them guns an‘ raise your fuckin' hands! I don't see ‘em empty, I drop you lower'n wormshit! The Saint raises an eye, not convinced.

dialogues.speaker: MARKSMAN, (0.S)
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) You point that pistol an’ see if I'm jokin', motherfucker! EXT. TULIP‘S TRUCK ~ NIGHT 64 Cassidy and Jesse have exited the truck and are peering b along the road. Tulip watches from the truck, wary.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It's hard to see - A sudden flash of light illuminates them as they stagger pack, shielding their eyes.  65 66 67 68 69 70

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massive flaring explosion with a rumbling, echoing blast, right on top of the two cruisers, with the ‘copter's tail sticking out of the inferno. Pieces of blazing car and ‘copter fly into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy's freaked. Jesse peers closely at us, shielding h eyes as the flames light his face.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Fuck me sideways!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silhouetted figure takes shape in the flames: the Saint He strides slowly from the wreckage. His clothes are burnt and sooty, but he seems otherwise unhurt. Slow-burning grimace on his face.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: (through gritted teeth) You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's eyes widen, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another three second flash. The demon and angel faces aga the angel's hand locked round the demon’s throat, the dem biting bloody strips of flesh from the angel’s neck - the silver clouds and bright sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse turns to the equally freaked Cassidy, and they star each other.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: ...He means you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse stares at him, then turns to the truck. A second later, Cassidy snaps out of it too.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Tulip, let's go! You come on if you're comin'!

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ right I am! They scramble into the truck and Tulip guns it. The trick races off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backlit by the flames, the Saint strides towards and then past us, unconcerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weary SECRETARY starts to stand as Hugo Root marches pa her, then freezes.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Sheriff Root, you can't just barge in ~ oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Average sized office, desk and chairs piled high with fil overflowing filing cabinets, photos on the wall, noticebo covered in documents. SHERIFF MEEKER, an amiable guy in his late forties, sits behind the desk and sips his coffee, relaxed. Meeker rare gets too agitated. DETECTIVE DINNINGS, 30, sits opposite him reading a file, enjoying the coffee he's drinking. He's a pretty sharp gu probably destined for bigger things. He's hard to shock, usually just quietly amused by other people.

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: Did somebody come in this coffee?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: {without looking up) I got excited when I heard you were on your way. Couldn't help it. So what d'you make of all this? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DINNINGS “ Well, judging by what he said over the radio here, I'd say your Sheriff Root is a one hundred per cent ~ The door opens and in barges Hugo, fuming. He's still covered in gore and dirt, dried blood smeared across his face.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Meeker, I want you to get right on that fuckin’ phone an' cali Washington. I want you to get those government sons of bitches down here to answer for what they done. Those by-the-Jesus, cocksuckin' Yankees think they can use us to test their goddamned experiments on, they can fuckin' think again. Dinnings stands, trying not to smile. Meeker just looks pained.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Now just hold on a minute there, Hugo. You been to the hospital to get yourself checked out?

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Ain't nothin' wrong with me, goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: {disliking him instantly) An' who the fuck are you supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: ' MEEKER
dialogues.text: Hugo, this is Detective Dinnings. He's - HUGO. I don't give a good fuck who he is. Do you know what's been let loose out there? Do you know what happened to my deputies tonight?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Well, I heard what you radiced in. One suspect matching the description

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: i) of the missing Minister from Annville apparently ordered you an‘ your boys to drop your guns...which you did...and the second suspect was able to withstand multiple gunshot wounds while killing every single deputy in your command.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Goddamn right. A moment passes, Meeker watching Hugo sadly, Hugo glaring back at him, Dinnings smiling as he studies Hugo.

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: Shit, case closed.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: (spitting) Fuck you. Dinnngs grins. Meeker looks weary.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Hugo...! O we We're wastin' time here, Meeker. You call Washington, tell ‘em we're onto them an' their goddamn F.B.I. genetic experiments. I know all about it, I read all the books. They been usin' Martian Nigger technology, tryin' to keep it quiet from us normal folks. By now Dinnings is struggling not to laugh, but Hugo does notice. Meeker seems genuinely sad for him.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Them sons of bitches built a fella can make you do whatever he tells you, an' a dirty motherfucker cop killer robot, an’ they've let ‘em both loose on us. (pointing to his face) I got the proof right here. See this? Deputy Kenny. I loved that boy like he was my own, an’ now I'm gonna have to go home and shampoo him outta my hair. An’ I wanna know just what the fuck you're planning to do @ about it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: {getting up) Okay, Hugo, thanks for your report. We've got boys turnin' out all over the state, an' the border posts have been alerted. We're gonna pick these people up sooner or later, an' as soon as we do we'll let you know. Hugo fumes. Meeker is sympathetic but firm. Dinnings look hard at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Get on home an' get some rest, huh? Hugo sneers. Then, after a last hard glare at both of the he turns and marches out of the office, slamming the door he goes. Meeker slumps a little, returns to his seat. Dinnings rub his jaw, smiles a little. A moment passes in silence.

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: Ain't you gonna call Washington?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: (smiling in spite of himself) Laugh it up. I been workin’ with Hugo Root for damn near twenty years now. We're agreed somebody killed his deputies, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: No doubt about it. I just ain't veady to call the X-Files yet, is all. Any word from the scene?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Tanks went up when the chopper crashed on the cars. Can't establish shit 'til they clean up a little. What you make of Annville, by the way?

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: Well, from the looks of things, I'd say somebody waited ‘til the good people had gathered to worship an' then laid in twenty gallons of napalm. Sure would like a word with this Reverend Custer about how he got out of it... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: eS MEEKER {doubtful} Well...

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: It's just a theory, Sheriff. Hell, gotta be better than Hugo's, right?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Right...oh, I know he looks like what happened when white met trash, but...

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: (smiling) He looks like a man who's not afraid to fuck his career in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Mm. You ever hear about what happened to Hugo's boy?

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: ‘Til tonight I never even heard of Hugo. e@ MEEKER Kid put a twelve-gauge to his head.

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: Oh, no shit? Meeker sits back, thoughtful, links his fingers behind hi head. .

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Not because of Hugo...let's see now, this boy woulda been about sixteen. You know how kids get at that age, all surly an' rebellious an' disrespectful, Hugo kicked his ass twice a day. Once he even put a cigarette out on his arm. An' all he got for his trouble was fuck you... Dinnings is getting interested.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Now, the boy's a big fan of one of these rock star boys, one of those modern ones sounds like a downs 6 syndrome fella set to music. This gets up Hugo's ass double. How's he s'posed to listen to Hank an‘ Waylon (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: an’ Tammy, with all that shit comin’ through the wall? Well, came the day the rock star blew his damn fool head off, the way these fellas are prone todo. Boy hears the news, tucks Hugo's Remington under his chin, an‘ follows in his hero's footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: Don't suppose Hugo mourned too much, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Didn't have to.

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: (surprised) The boy's alive? Meeker starts fumbling through a desk drawer.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Bear with me a minute, will you? Yeah, after taking a slug through the face point blank, and after six or seven cperations to fix him up, the boy is indeed alive. Ah, here we are... He comes up with an 8x10 photo, which we never see. at it, frowning thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: I got a teenage boy of my own, and every time he pisses me off - every dumb thing he says to his Mom, every joint I catch him with, or just when I hear him playing that goddamn rap shit: I take a look at this...and all of a sudden he don't seem quite so bad. 33. 73 He looks He turns the photo round, holds it up. Looking past it, w see Dinnings gape in shock and horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74 ARSEFACE opens the door and sticks his head out at us, filling the screen. Arseface's dialogue is a stream of grunts and moans - and he never sounds anything other than completely cheerful. sticking your tongue hard into your lower lip, then speak

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: his lines. A translation is run in subtitles along the bottom of the screen.

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: (Hi, Dad!) Hugo barges past him into the house, doing his best to ig his son completely. Arseface doesn't seem to notice.

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: (How was your day?)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugo walks into the front room, fuming quietly as Arsefac follows him, chattering away. The house is sparsely furnished, and not very clean. Worn-out furniture, old TV set. Hugo dumps his hat on the coffee table, sits down.

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: {Still no letter from Mom, but I bet she'll be home any day now, huh? You want to relax and I'll bring you a beer? Sound good?) He heads for the kitchen, turns, gives the thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: (You betcha!) Left alone, Hugo stares hatefully at the wall for a momen pissed off at his wretched lot in life. Then he closes hi eyes, puts his head in his hands, and breaks down complet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar is a wide, one-storey building out in the desert, with several cars and pick-ups - including Tulip's - in t parking lot. Across the road from it is a small all night supermarket/mini-mall, with more cars parked outside. See to be closing. The bar, however, is very much open: a lar neon sign over it reads THE RATTLER. People come and go. Music drifts out into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, the Rattler is a fairly dead kind of place. Same of smoke, neon and gloom that we've seen before. Plenty o people in, but everyone seems to stay in little groups or couples ~ no dancing, no boisterous groups around the bar (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: good place to go to drink yourself into a wretched mess a ery into your whiskey. Couple of WAITRESSES at work, not exactly rushed off thei feet. One is young and pretty. Cassidy and Tulip sit at a table near the back, Tulip try to be inconspicuous. Cassidy glances around, naturally curious. He smokes and drinks beer, she has some kind of stupid cocktail with an umbrella in it. A glass of Bourbo and ice sits in front of an empty chair.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Happenin’ fuckin' place, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Keep it down, will you? We're meant to be blending in.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (amused) Blend in? Sure you just went on a shopping spree across the road there.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: I had to get him something to wear. I mean, he’s going to stand out a mile walking around covered in burnt vags, isn't he? And by the way, would you mind telling me what the fuck you think you're doing following us in here?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Well, you helped me out of a tight spot back there. I reckon one good turn deserves another.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: {leaning forward) Look, he and I have got a lot to talk about. I-mean a fuck of a lot. So you know which good turn you can do for us, don‘t you?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (leaning forward) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Fuck. Off.  78 79 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny, grimy little room. Jesse dumps all his old clothes into the trash. Last to g is the white collar, which he hesitates on. Lowering it, studies his reflection in the mirror intently. He looks a little bit pissed off, a sense of determination.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What the fuck is happenin’ to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy leans back, laughing to himself. Tulip glares, clearly irritated.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Aw, now that's cold...

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Cold. I see. You try to steal my truck, and now you're sitting here talking about helping us - which I don't believe for a second, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I have to admit, I do have a wee bit of an ulterior motive.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Aye. This trick your boyfriend does, where he can make people do things like he's speakin’ the word of God? Well, I can see one or two possibilities hangin' round with a fella like that.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: I'll bet you can.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: “Miss Crawford, Miss Turlington - smear my handsome Irish friend in Southern Comfort, an' then lick it all off an’ start again. Mr. Jagger - (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: load Keith's coke into the back of that 747. Then sign this check.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: And why would Jesse want to do all that for you, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Hey, I don’t believe in gettin’ somethin’ from nothin', you know. I might be able to help you.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Hidden talents, love. Tulip raises an eye.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I'm Irish, for starters. That never hurts. (smiling) An' there's something else you should know about me, too...

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (looking past her, grinning) Oh look, there's your boyfriend now. Blendin' in. . Jesse enters the bar dressed in his new clothes, the whit collar setting off the black outfit. He's cleaned himself a bit too, and cuts quite a dashing figure as he strides across the bar towards the rear table. He seems to radiat supreme self-confidence, lighting up a Marlboro as he goe hardly aware of anyone else. Several folks notice him, ineluding the pretty young waitress, who likes what she sees and discreetly sets off after him. A bunch of REDNECKS notice her noticing him, instantly disapproving. These guys are all young bucks on their fif or sixth beer, just about ready to go looking for trouble Jesse notices nene of this. He moseys over to the table, watched by Tulip, who can't help but smile. A hint of nostalgia here for her. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse sits down, picks up his glass. Cassidy smiles amiab Jesse thinks slight edge. Off goes the little glare.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (to Cassidy) You still here?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Jesus, I thought Texans were supposed to be friendly.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: {genuinely curious) Where the hell did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I made it up. I like to believe that best of people, you know? about that, finds himself smiling, but with a The waitress arrives.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: You ready for another drink, Reverend?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yeah, same again for me an' the lady. (to Cassidy) You want another beer?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Aye, please. waitress, smiling at Jesse, not seeing Tulip's

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: That's awful decent of you.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Not’ really. You're payin'. They smile shrewdly at each other for a moment. Then Cass grins.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: It occurs to me we haven't been properly introduced. My name's Cassidy. You're Jesse an‘ you're Turnip, is that right? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hissing) Tulip.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Aye.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: {to Jesse) Before you arrived, Cassidy was trying to think of one good reason why he shouldn't just fuck off and die.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I told you, I know things other fellas don't. When you've been around for as long as I have, you pick up all sorts of useful wee tricks.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What d'you mean, as long as you have? What you doin' out here anyway? e@ CASSIDY Aw, y'know, seein' the world. That's how I came to be borrowin' your truck, as a matter of fact. Through a series of adventures too fuckin’ mental to go into now, I found myself stranded in the arse-end of nowhere. Cheers for givin’ us a lift out of it. (pause) I notice you're still wearin' the collar, there.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (thoughtful) Yeah. Well, I reckon I still have business with the Lord. {lights a cigarette, offers Cassidy one) I'd like to know what the fuck happened to me today, for one thing. How I came to be able to do what I did to those deputies. An’ who the hell that gunfighter son of a bitch is, too. @ Tulip nudges him as the waitress returns with their dri and they all clam up. The girl pays special attention to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79° CONTINUED: (4) 79 = Jesse as she sets down the drinks. Nobody notices, but couple of the rednecks have sidled over to eavesdrop.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: I brung your change. Hey, I been wonderin’: are you a real Preacher?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Now, what would a real one be doin' in a den of sin like this? You go on an' keep it, honey.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: (beaming) Thank you, Reverend. Cassidy forks over a ten-spot, and off she goes.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Don't mention it. Well, it's pretty bleedin' obvious to me that all this stuff's linked up. I mean, from what you were sayin' earlier: you get hit by this...whatever it is, you incinerate your congregation-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not by choice. Well, probably not.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You develop this word of God, an’ all of a sudden you've got the gunfighter after you.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: ‘Cause he doesn't want me doin’ this shit, or somethin’? Yeah, that figures.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I'i1 tell you one thing about him: he looks like a good man to avoid like the fucking plague.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Maybe so.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Maybe so?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: @ Like I say, I want some answers. If it turns out I gotta go to him to get ‘em,..there it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see what he did out there tonight? The bastard can shoot down helicopters. Bullets bounce off him. He can walk through a fuckin’ firestorm, for Jesus' sake.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (leaning in, annoyed) I don't care if he can shoot cruise missiles from his pecker. Nobody - I mean nobody - fucks with me like I been fucked with today an’ walks away with their teeth still intact. An’ if that motherfucker wants to get in my way he's gonna be wearin’ his six- guns up his ass. A pause. Cassidy seems rather fazed, not sure what to thi

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You're not much of a one for backin' down in the face of adversity, are you, Jesse? @ Jesse just drinks his bourbon. Tulip looks at Cassidy, wearily shaking her head: No he isn't. Nor was he ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very different sort of bar, the TEN-TEN. A number of eighteen-wheelers parked outside, Loud country music blar from within, along with raised voices, shouts. Sounds goo and lively. A truck roars past in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is indeed a much livelier place than the Rattler. Th clientele is generally older - truckers in their 30s and cutting loose, a jukebox pumping out CaW at full volume, waitresses getting friendly with the boys. A number of locals about too, a few couples about - basically lots of friends meeting up, enjoying their all too rare times together as they pass through. Several folks dancing. Up at the bar, a slightly toasted trucker slaps his pals the back, kisses the barmaid goodbye, and weaves for the door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TRUCKER
dialogues.text: ---I gotta go, boys. I need to sleep this off an' be halfway to Memphis by tomorrow night. I'll see you.

dialogues.speaker: BARMAID
dialogues.text: You say hi to your wife for me, Prank.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCKER
dialogues.text: (laughing) That'll be the day. Out he goes. The others go back to their conversation. A moment passes. Then there's the most God-almighty bang and the trucker i flung back into the bar with half his chest blown away, frantically trying to stay on his feet. He falls backward smashes into the jukebox - the music stops. Then he falls the floor and dies in a bloody heap. Everyone gapes. A confused buzz of fear and confusion fills the air. Peop move to the fallen trucker. Then one guy turns towards th door, freezes.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, It's the Saint, framed in the doorway, blue smoke curling from his pistol. Everyone turns to stare, riveted. He strides up to the bar, oblivious to their stares. There's a loud clunk as he sets the revolver on the bar. He fixes the petrified barmaid with his steely glare.

dialogues.speaker: , SAINT
dialogues.text: Whiskey. Mouth clamped shut for fear she'll scream, the barmaid se down a glass and pours him a shot. The noise of the flowi whiskey is the only thing audible. The Saint knocks it back, sets down the glass. For just a moment he seems thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: First drink I've had...since Wounded Knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 82 49. CONTINUED: (2) al The moment passes, the icy cold returns to his eyes and h reaches for the pistol. Sudden panic shows on the faces o the people around him. A sense of something terrible abou to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, Tulip and Cassidy have left the Rattler. Tulip isn too happy. Jesse grimaces a little. Cassidy follows, enjoying their argument.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: "You got a nice little ass, honey. You go ahead an' keep Tulip's last five bucks."

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Aw, now that wasn't it at all...

dialogues.speaker: REDNECK LEADER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You don't like it here, drink some other goddamned place. They turn. Advancing slowly on them are the little band o rednecks from the bar, just drunk enough to want to get i it. The leader is a brawny thug in a baseball cap. Six of them in total. Cassidy steps in front of Tulip so he's just behind and t the side of Jesse. Jesse remains cool, even polite.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I like it fine. The leader stops about a yard from Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: REDNECK LEADER
dialogues.text: That ain't what you said to Mona. Called it a den of sin, or some shit. I heard you.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (weary) Oh, Jesus...look, if she's your girl, relax, okay? I ain't interested. You got me all wrong.

dialogues.speaker: REDNECK LEADER
dialogues.text: (turning cap back to front) I reckon I got you just right, motherfucker! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 Se.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse changes in an instant. His eyes narrow. He goes icy cold. Cassidy steps up behind him, grins.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You know, I think the problem is that she isn't his girl.

dialogues.speaker: REDNECK LEADER
dialogues.text: You sayin’ I'm some kinda homo?! Jesse is icy cold. Behind him, Cassidy's grin becomes positively predatory.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I'm sayin’ you'd crawl over fifty good pussies to get to a fat boy's ass. The leader moves - too slow. Jesse slams two fingers up h nostrils, twists, and rips upwards. A terrible ripping an gout of blood. The guy howls and falls. The others are so surprised, Jesse has time to step in and hook a right, le and another right into the second guy's face. He drops li a ton of shit. A third guy reaches for Jesse, but Cassidy grabs his shoulder, smiles nastily, and headbutts him in the face. massive, almost hollow-sounding impact. The guy's eyes bu and he falls, nose spread all over his face like a burst tomato. Jesse ducks a swing from number four, sinks a low one int the guy's stomach. The guy folds up around it, gasping. Number five jumps on Cassidy's back. The sixth guy dances pack out of trouble. The sixth guy sneakily snaps open a switchblade, waits fo his chance. Jesse holds number four against a car and punches the shi out of him. Cassidy flips the fifth one over his shoulder. The guy flies at least ten yards through the air. Tulip's eyes widen as she follows the are of his descent.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 Sl.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Big crash as the guy smashes into the side of a pick-up t like a broken rag doll, upside down. Tulip turns back to the fight, freaks.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Cassidy!

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Yeah? Cassidy turns ~- right into the sixth guy's attack. He sl the switchblade clean through the plastic lens of Cassidy shades, on into the eye beyond. Cassidy steps back, hand going to his eye, then coming aw again. Tulip stares. Cassidy and the guy look at each other. Cassidy is calm. The handle of the blade juts from his shades lens, blade the way in. The guy is frozen. Beyond them, we get a glimpse of Jesse still demolishing his own victim. Cassidy reaches up, holds the shades with one hand, tugs blade out of his eye with no discernible pain whatsoever. Blood and jelly slide from the blade, leaking down from pehind his shades as well.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Hang on a second there, mate. Tiil be right with you. Pop. Out comes the biade, slathered in gore. Tulip's eyes widen further.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Right. C'mere. We hear the guy scream in terror - a scream which is just suddenly cut off.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: J...0...Jesse? Jesse quits beating on the redneck, whose face is now pul Jesse holds him up with one hand and turns, then drops hi Jesse's jaw drops open in amazement as he stares.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Jesus Fuckin' Christ. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cassidy holds his would-be assailant's lifeless body up b the hair, spits out a lump of bloody meat, lets the blood pour down his chin. The meat is from the guy's neck, whic Cassidy has just bitten a hole in. Blood spurts out in lo jets, pumping into the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: What? He hauls the corpse up, sinks his mouth into the wound, a starts drinking the blood as it pours out. Loud gulping noises can be heard. Tulip, still freaked, turns slowly to the riveted Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Say something! Cassidy quits drinking for a second, gasps with delight.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What the fuck you do that for...?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: @ I was hungry.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: So you figured you’d snack on this fella's neck? What are you, some kinda fuckin' vampire?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Well, I just flung a fella twenty feet through the air, I took a switchblade straight in the brain without blinkin', an' I tore a fella's throat open so I could drink his blood. I'd say I was pretty obviously some kind of fuckin' vampire, wouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It...can't be...

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (laughing in disbelief) Oh aye, listen to Mister Normal! Utterly thrown, Jesse stares at Tulip, trying to fit this e thing into his head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake, he's doing it again! He is indeed, gulping away at the guy's neck.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (angry) ; Goddamnit, Cassidy! Knock it off! But Cassidy clearly likes it too much, gulping merrily aw Bloed dribbles everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (between gulps) Just - a minute - Jesse snarls, and once again his voice echoes with his ne found power.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (word of God} Knock it off! Cassidy is amazed. He flings the corpse to the ground, furious.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: For fuck's sake! Jesse and Cassidy yell at each other, both furious, right each other's faces.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Don't you fuckin' dare do that shit to me! Nobody tells me what to do! An' I don't know if you noticed, but that wee shite stuck a knife in my eye!

dialogues.speaker: , JESSE
dialogues.text: That don't make him a two-dollar Slurpee! An' I'd've told you to fuck yourself the minute I laid eyes on you, if I'd known you were some kinda fuckin' abomination! Cassidy freezes, stunned. For just a second he looks hurt then his face sets in a pissed-off grimace. Jesse faces h with narrowed eyes. Neither man will give ground. Then Cassidy turns on his heel and stomps away.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Tulip watches him go, then turns to Jesse, who has turned away and is angrily lighting a Marlboro. An engine starts. Tulip turns in that direction, eyes narrowing.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Forget it, Tulip. I don't wanna talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: But Jesse~

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I said I don't wanna-

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Jesse, he's stealing my truck! Again! So he is. The truck pulls out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Shit! He charges after the truck, but it’s already racing off d the road.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Come back here, you unbelievable motherfucker! I'll kick your fucking ass to death! Fuck! He gives up, roaring hatefully.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You worthless son of a bitch! Tulip's hand comes into shot between us and Jesse, firing gun. Jesse gapes. Tulip snarls with hatred, blasting away until the pistol locks dry. Jesse stares.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Bastard...! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The engine noise disappears into the night, along with th echo of the gunshots.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (grabbing the gun) What the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: (grabbing it back) It's mine, is what it is!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Tulip, what are you doing with this fucking thing?

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: I'm defending myself. Behind them, several people are exiting the bar, drawn by noise. Jesse and Tulip notice them.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: @ Come on, let's get out of here. Once they get a look at your little massacre they're gonna have the cops here in no <ime.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (reluctant TI dunno. I'm gettin' sick of runnin’ away all the goddamn time.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: I'm sure there'll be plenty more people to beat up later. Come on, for Christ's sake... They melt into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy's victim lies in a bodybag, face still frozen in horror. A hand zips the bag shut. Two PARAMEDICS lift the bodybag, carrying it towards a pa of ambulances parked in the Rattler parking lot. Three sheriff's dept. cruisers are there too, blue lights slowl * flashing. A small crowd watches as the paramedics load battered rednecks into the ambulances, either on stretche or helping them climb in.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Several deputies are questioning people in the crowd. Oth keep the main crowd back from the crime scene. Dinnings and Meeker are questioning the one redneck still standing, the second one Jesse hit. His face has been bandaged, he's a bit woozy.

dialogues.speaker: REDNECK
dialogues.text: An' then the Reverend fella, he hit me so hard I felt like a goddamn truck went over me - an’ when I wake up a minute or two later, the ugly one’s bitin’ into Horace’s neck an’ drinkin’ his goddamn blood! Dinnings turns away. Meeker eases the guy towards the ambulance, them joins Dinnings.

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this, asshole night?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Thing is, I showed him that photo of Reverend Custer we @ got, an’ the guy swears it’s the same fella kicked his ass.

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: This is the guy swears we got Dracula on the loose... A DEPUTY comes over.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Sheriff Meeker? Sir? We just heard - nine-~one~one call came in about a half-hour ago, from that truckstop out by the county line, the Ten-Ten? Somethin' about shootin’, an' a guy sounds kinda like Sheriff Roct's cop killer...

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Got cut off. Meeker and Dinnings look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: That's a hell of a long way from here...Okay, son. Get ‘em ready to go. Exit the deputy.

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: You're really takin’ this seriously?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Enough to take a look. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Tulip stand at the side of the road, watching t light of the cruisers and ambulances as they pull away fr the distant Rattler and disappear into the night. Jesse turns, notices Tulip is shivering a bit, hugging herself. She's not exactly dressed for the cool desert night. Jesse takes his coat off, wraps it round her. She' a little startled, looks up at him. They find themselves very close for a moment. Then they move apart, both rather awkward.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: You think it'd be safe to try that motel down the road? I'm about ready to drop.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (smiling) I guess it has been kind of a long day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulip’s pick-up races past us. ‘INT, TULIP'S PICK-UP - NIGHT 86 cassidy is driving, going hell for leather, clearly not i very good mood,

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You really know how to pick your moments, Cassidy. You stupid bollocks.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He sulks a bit. Then he looks curious, sniffing the air. seems a bit surprised at what he smells, and pulls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck stops at the side of the road. Cassidy cuts the engine and sticks his head out the window. He takes a lon deep breath - and freezes, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Jesus! He starts her up again, and the truck pulls away and race off down the road. Way, way out in the distance, far from the speeding truck curious blood-red glow lines the horizon. It's much too r to be dawn, almost like a line of lava spilling from a fa

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: A crummy little collection of cabins, a neon MOTEL sign, a central office. Few cars parked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Tulip enter. She has the key. t's a shitty room everything old and worn. A bed, a TV set, a phone, a door the bathroom. Jesse slips his collar back into place.

dialogues.speaker: TULIB
dialogues.text: “Mr. and Mrs. Smith?" Jesus Christ, Jesse...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Fooled him, didn't it? That boy looked dumb enough to jerk off with a fistful of barbed wire. He ain't gonna be callin’ any law. Tulip shrugs, sits, takes out her pistol. She ejects the clip, bangs in a new one. Then she notices Jesse watching

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Why the hell you packin' that goddamn thing, anyhow?

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Well, you remember - hey, wait a minute! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: It's none of your business what I've been doing. You wouldn't say jackshit about becoming a Preacher, or why you dumped me, or who it is that's so fucking important you promise you'll throw your life away for them...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I was just worried for you, is all.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: {interested) You were? He just looks at her. Of course he was.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Okay. How about we both ‘fess up, then? You tell me your sorry tale, I'll tell you mine. Jesse is caught off guard. He watches her, curious. She just smiles back, interested, challenging him. Then he lowers his gaze, resigned.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Hell, why not. With all this other shit down on our heads, = guess it don't make a goddamn bit of difference anyway. Tulip smiles, pleased. Then Jesse looks up.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: But you go first. That catches her for a moment. She hesitates, then takes deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: I ought to say right up front that you're not going to like this bit. Okay...after I realized you weren't coming back, I kind of got myself into some trouble. I was drinking quite a bit, except I was borrowing the money to do it, and, well, ha-ha, (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: _ TULIP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ) you can sometimes forget just how much you're putting away...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Who were you borrowin' from?

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Macavoy.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Macavoy?! That son of a bitch in Houston? That's the motherfucker tried to rip us off om that Lamborghini thing an' I swore I was gonna-

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Yes, but I had no-one else to go to, did I? (calmer) So what with the drinking and then looking for you in the occasional moments of sobriety, I let the whole thing get out of control and Macavoy called a halt to the proceedings. @ Wanted his money back. {f couldn't pay. So he said I had to do something for him in exchange... Jesse is watching her very carefully now.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Christ, I don't know. I didn’t have any choice. You swear there's things you would never do ~ you could never do - and all of a sudden circumstances change and you find yourself doing stuff, no matter how awful it is.

dialogues.speaker: " JESSE
dialogues.text: (quietly appalled) You...you were a hooker?

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: (exploding) No I was not a fucking hooker! Jesus Christ, Custer! I can't believe you fucking said that! What the fuck do you think I am? @ But Jesse is too busy getting his heartrate back to nor answer, relieved beyond measure. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 30 91 92 93 él. CONTINUED: (3) a9

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: (peeved) but I suppese in a way it was worse than that. It happened about a month ago. In Houston,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashback to Tulip standing on a street corner in a shitt part of town, purse over her shoulder, nervous. She just can't relax. She turns towards us, notices something that sets her even more on edge. A black Mercedes is parked just outside a bar, which seem have just closed. Two scruffily-suited THUGS wait at the while a THIRD locks the door of the bar, pulls down the shutters. Also at the bar is a FAT GUY in a slightly bett suit, clearly their boss. Tulip watches, now downright scared.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Oh my Ged. I can’t believe I’m gonna do this. She glances down at her purse. The third guy finishes locking up and gets in the back of car, with the fat guy between him and another thug. The l one gets in front to drive. Tulip, staring, terrified, takes a step forward. Then another. And another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver is just about to start up when he notices Tuli coming slowly towards them. He frowns, then smiles, and turns to the guys’ in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulip advances like a nervous mouse, not really looking a the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the car busts up laughing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FAT GUY
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Looks to me like too much fuckin‘ Prozac. Hey, watch this-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
