dialogues.text: The thug in the rear seat - on the side facing Tulip - le out the window and grins at her. We can just see the thug the other side of the fat guy leaning round to watch.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Pardon me, Ma'am! Tulip jumps, startled out of her daze.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Wahh!! The thug makes a two-inch diameter circle with his thumb forefinger, smiles innocently.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: You reckon you could get your mouth around something this wide? ‘Cause if you could, I'd like to marry you. Tulip freezes, stunned. We hear the carload of jerks crac up laughing. Then Tulip’s face changes to a look of total fury and she pulls the Desert Eagle from her purse.

dialogues.speaker: THUG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Holy shit!! And we freeze frame right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is staring wide-eyed at Tulip, mouth shut, but she doesn't notice. She seems really irritated.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: See, what had me so terrified was the thought of using a gun on someone. I mean my Dad was a cop, he taught me all about guns and defending myself and everything, and now here was this guy, this rival of Macavoy's I was supposed to blow away...I mean just (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TULIP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kill him, put an end to him there in the street...f knew I couldn't do it, I froze. And then that asshole went and gave me whatever it is you need to pull a trigger. Or so I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hold on the freeze frame for an instant, then Tulip completes the draw and fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second thug - not the one who spoke to Tulip, but the who leant over to see better, gets his jaw blown off. Blo flies. Panic in the back of the car.

dialogues.speaker: FAT GUY
dialogues.text: Jesus fuckin' Christ!

dialogues.speaker: UNEURT THUG
dialogues.text: Oh my God! The wounded guy fumbles in his lap, picks up the severed lower jaw, stares at it. It's a ghastly mess of bone, mea and teeth. His pals stare at him. He stares at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulip is frozen, smoking gun in hand, eyes bulging from h skull. She claps a hand to her mouth, looking for all the world as if she'd sworn in church.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: (squeaking) Oh! Her p.o.v.: all four of the guys in the car, staring out her, frozen to their seats, stunned. Tulip bolts and runs down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulip looks up, anxious to change the subject.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: So anyway, your turn. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (fazed) I don't think so...

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, I know. It was a horrible thing to do. JI know that. But just for that instant, after being so terrified, I was sure I could really do it, I think that's what scares me the most.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I'm glad to hear that. Tulip looks up, curious.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: ‘Cause the Tulip I remember, the thought of takin' someone's life - even an asshole's life - woulda scared the livin’ hell outta her. She smiles a little. So does he. A warm moment between them. Tulip even laughs a little, then more.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Yours is gonna have to be a pretty wild fucking story to beat that. Jesse smiles sadly.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well. My Daddy died. Tulip stops short, looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I got word that time we were in Phoenix. Nurse said on the phone he didn’t have long. You were shopping, remember? I couldn't wait ‘til when we agreed to meet - had to just head Straight for home. Got there just in time, way it turned out. He was hurtin’ real bad. You never met my Daddy, but I swear he was the strongest man I ever knew. He pauses. Tulip watches, concerned. This is clearly aifficult for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that day, Lyin' there with that goddamned cancer eatin’ him up...coughin' an' sweatin’, all the muscles gone from his arms, so thin this little bitty nurse could pick him up an' turn him over...hair all gone, skin like chalk...that day I looked at him, an' I saw that strong man had been cut down to nothin'. I sat down at his bedside an' took his hand, an' he looked at me...an' all of a sudden I could see he hadn't changed a bit. That strength of his was still right there. He raises his head now, fiercely proud for just that mome

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Still right there in my Daddy's eyes. Tulip is genuinely affected by this, sorry for him. His voice softens again.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: @ It was him, Tulip. He got me to become a minister. Just like he'd been, and his daddy before him. An’ I looked in those eyes of his an’ I knew I had no choice but to do just like he wanted.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Couldn't you have told me?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Oh, I thought about it. I was gonna do it. An‘ then I thought - an' say what? Sorry, honey, I gotta leave you for the church. Too bad about your’ broken heart. I figured the best thing was to disappear outta your life. 1 knew it’d be hard on you, an‘ I regret it more'n anything I ever did in my life, but...aw, Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: You know...if you could've told me this last night, I think I would have @ understood. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I didn't want you to understand. I wanted you to go on hating me. To leave me outta your life an’ go away an’ have a chance of being happy. An' then, I dunno, I'd be able to carry on doin’ what I had to do, no matter how shitty it was. (pause) See, I knew I caused my Daddy pain with the life I was leadin'. He told me, he said, “If you make one promise in your life that means anything, son - please let it be this one.” He brought me into this world. He fed an' clothed me an' raised me the way he thought was just an’ proper. An' seein’ him in that bed I knew I had one final chance to do right by him, the way he always did for me. [I became a Preacher for my Daddy, Tulip...because it was just the right goddamned thing to do. e@ He looks at her, smiles sadly.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: An’ now look. I did the right thing. I fucked up my life, an’ I fucked up yours even worse, an’ what I achieved by it don't amount to a bucket of horseshit. He slumps a bit. Tulip looks up, struck by a thought.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Jesse, why don't we just get the hell out of this madness, right now? Just run for it - you use that power you've got to order anyone who messes with us out of our way, and we keep going and don't stop ‘til we're far away from Texas.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (smiling sadly) Tulip...I like Texas. An' I'm through runnin’. @ Her face falls a bit.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ® rasse Tt sure is temptin' to do what you're sayin’, but I can't. A thing like I got, bein’ able to make people do stuff against their will ~ that ain't the kind of thing you can take lightly. I mean, you see what I just did to Cassidy? That was wrong. What right have I got to tell him what to do? You got the power of God, you got to use it right.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: But he fucking killed the guy...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Guy tried to kill him. You tellin’ me if some son of a bitch tried that with you, you wouldn't blow ‘em away with that cannon you got in your purse?

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, but ~ Jesus, you saw what he did! He's a fucking monster, Jesse!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Oh hell, I'm already regrettin' sayin’ that to him. "Abomination"...I never stood in judgement like that on a fella before...

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: T think you had an excuse!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Maybe so. But I can't just walk away from this now. An’ I'd like to think I can still face down the bad guys an’ find out what's been done to me without becomin’ some kinda all-out shitheel. A moment passes as she sadly studies him.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesse. You and your goddamn pride. eo (pause) And that's just it, isn't it? Maybe I'm the biggest idiot in the world,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TULIP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: or maybe I'm just a sucker for punishment...but guys who back down when trouble comes along, who eat shit all the time and learn to like it = you can find them anytime you want. But a crazy, hard-headed John Wayne son of a bitch like you - you only come along once in a lifetime. That surprises hima little. She moves closer, smiles, obviously about to kiss him.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: You know what I think?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (taken aback) After everything I did to you- She puts a finger to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: I think we're stuck with each other, tough guy. They kiss for a long time, then break off to look at each other, both smiling. Then they kiss again and slowly desc towards the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV screen - which isn't turned on. We move slowly behind it, looking over it to see Hugo and Arseface sitting on the couch, watching the TV. Both have bottles of bud. Hugo fumes quietly, bitter as hell.

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: (Sure wish we could afford to get the TV fixed, Dad!) No response from Hugo. Arseface bangs on, oblivious to hi dad‘s silent hatred.

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: (Must be real exciting being Sheriff! Boy, I wish I could come along on one of your cases! You think I could be your deputy one day, Dad?) Hugo's so uptight he looks like he could crack nuts with asshole. The bottle starts to shake in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: (Father and son lawmen! Me watching your back! What a team we'd be, huh?) The phone rings - barely a squeak comes from it before Hu snatches it up.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Hugo Root here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeker is driving, talking on the radio. Dinnings sits beside him.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: It's Meeker, Hugo, I ain't interruptin' anything, am I? Dinnings cracks up. Meeker just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (over radio) Meeker, you ain't interruptin' fuckin' shit. You make that cali to Washington like I told you?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Top of my list, Hugo, top of my list. Listen, we had word of a shooting out at the Ten-Ten. From the sound of things, your perp from the roadblock just might be involved.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: (over radio) The Preacher?

dialogues.speaker: , MEEKER
dialogues.text: Uh-uh, the other one. The, uh, gunfighter, I think you described him. But we did get a positive I.D. on Reverend Custer earlier on tonight. Anyhow, me an’ Detective Dinnings are on our way out to the Ten-Ten right now. Thought you might wanna join us.  102 103 104 70. INT. HUGO’S HOUSE - NIGHT 102 Hugo is still on the phone, grim. Over his shoulder we ca see Arseface watching and listening, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Damn right I do, but what about the Preacher? He's the son of a bitch disarmed us an’ left us at that other bastard'’s mercy in the first place! (pause) Oh, you don't? Well, you go ahead an' rush right on over to the Ten- Ten: I'm gonna stop by the Rattler an' do some’ real investigatin’. I keep tellin' you there's more to this shit than you think, an’ that Custer'’s the key to all of it. (pause) Because it's fuckin' obvious, is why. An’ you'd know it too if you weren't sittin’ there sneerin' at me with that faggot Dinnings. I can hear him there, laughin' at me. You tell him fuck you. (pause) Then fuck you too, Meeker. I'm gonna find Custer an' blow this whole fuckin’ thing wide open. I'm gonna have them fucks up in Washington good an' tight by their John Thursdays, an’ you know what you're gonna have? Dick. He slams down the phone. Arseface creeps out towards us, unnoticed by Hugo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugo exits the house, slamming the door behind him. He shoves his hat on, buckles on his gunbelt, stomps angrily towards his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugo gets in.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Meeker. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He starts her up.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: I'll show you some goddamned law enforcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car speeds away. The rear lights fade into the night. Then, from the gloom at the side of the house, Arseface pedals out on a BMX bicycle that's really far too small f him. Legs pumping furiously, he races off after Hugo as f as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Tulip lie in bed, both apparently asleep. Their clothes lie all over the place. Just a sheet over them. Jesse opens his eyes, dozy for a second. Then he turns to Tulip, studies her for a long moment. He gets out of bed creeps to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, cramped room with a dim light. Letting the sink fill with water, Jesse dozily watches himself in the litt mirror above the sink.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Nice goin’, Custer. You think of anything else you can do to complicate things even more, you be sure an' let me know. He leans down, splashes water on his face. He stands straight again, freezes. The image in the mirro is now one of roaring, blazing flames. Weird thing is, th light from them is trapped within the mirror, doesn't illuminate the bathroom at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulip wakes up, dozy, then registers Jesse's not beside h She sits up, wary. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse stares, face twisted, completely bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flames blaze away. They seem to go on forever. Nothin else is visible. Then, centred in shot, we see a small, black object silhouetted against the fire. Moving closer, we realize that it's two figures locked together, having very violent sex. One is an ANGELIC MALE just like the one whose face we glimpsed when Jesse was possessed by Genesis. He has vast white wings, golden hai big muscles, and no clothes. He holds his partner by the throat, roaring in agony and anger. The other is the same DEMON FEMALE we saw during Jesse's possession ~ huge curv horns, cloven hooves, shiny, jet-black body, clawed hands big fangs. She has her legs wrapped around the Angel's wa as they hump away like crazy. She tears her claws down hi back, Spraying blood across his wings, and bites chunks o flesh from his chest. INT. MOTEL BATHROOM - NIGHT lili Jesse continues to stare, jaw suddenly dropping at what h sees.

dialogues.speaker: INT, MIRROR/VISION 112
dialogues.text: The two figures, still locked together, soar upwards unti they're high over the flames, both screaming in ecstasy n The fires are far below them, and then disappear from vie they emerge into a beautiful skyscape of rolling white an silver clouds and sparkling sunlight. The Angel and Demon become more gentle, halding each othe looking into each other’s eyes.  113 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Tulip comes in, puzzled, holding a she around her, Jesse continues to stare into the mirror, riveted.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Jesse? She moves beside him, looks past him. All she sees are their reflections. She looks curiously at Jesse, who's still gaping into the mirror in disbelief, face twisted.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Yeah...well...you certainly are hideous. I'm surprised your Mom didn't sell you to the circus, Jesse!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (snapping out of it) Huh?

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Are you okay? What the hell are you staring in the mirror for? .

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (after a long pause) . Looked to me kinda like an angel of the Lord an’ a demon from Hell. Fucking. There's an even longer pause while Tulip takes a hard loo the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: (doubtful) I see...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: No, wait a minute, goddamnit. I saw them already tonight. Both of ‘em. An' I saw ‘em when that fuckin’ thing hit me in the church, just before everybody got fried. I'm tellin’ you, Tulip: I saw their faces.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: But what does that have to do with angels and demons?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: T dunno, but it's showin’ them to me. It wants me to know what they did. It gave me this power, the gunfighter's after me because of it, an' now this...

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: And they were really...doing it?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: They were fuckin' each other's brains out.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Well, look...this thing that, I dunno, possessed you, for want of a better word - if it’s showing you them doing that, and you saw them when it hit you in church...well, what if the thing in your head is-

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Their child? They stare at each other for a moment, amazed. Then Jesse turns away, wary, thinking hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy exits Tulip's truck and walks quickly towards the door of the Ten-Ten. He sniffs the air again. His face lights up and he heads on in. Dim light from within, but noise or sign of movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy freezes as he enters, face suddenly twisting in disbelief. The scene that greets him in the low light of the bar is nightmare. Two dozen bodies lie on the floor of the bar i vast lake of dark red blood. All bear the massive, gaping wounds that the Saint’s guns deliver. Severed arms lie he and there. A couple of bodies are actually headless. Gore is splattered across the walls. Tables have been knocked (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: over ~ a sense of panicked rush towards the rear of the r which no-one quite managed to reach.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: I knew what you were the first time I laid eyes on you, boy. Cassidy turns, sees the Saint standing in the gloom by th bar, looking grimly back at him. Cassidy is instantly seared, can’t help but show it.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: An' I knew a bloodsucker like you would come runnin', if I was to set the table for you. (pause) That thing inside the Preacher - that'll draw scum like you from miles around. That urge you got to take a look at Texas - weren't you wonderin’ where that came from? Cassidy is startled, realizing the Saint is right.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: Now: I reckon we can make it work the other way around. I reckon you can give that Preacher a call an' he'll come runnin’. Cassidy's eyes narrow slowly. He gets angry. He points Slowly to the carnage on the floor further back.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You killed them to get me here? The Saint just looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You fuckin’ dirty bastard...! D'you think I want any part of this? D'you think I'd sell out Jesse Custer to a piece of shite like you? (angrier) Do you think I'm some kind of worthless fuckin' animal or somethin’?

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: That's exactly what I think. Cassidy loses it, strides towards the Saint, drawing a fi back to strike - but the Saint pulls his pistol, fast as (CONTINUED)
115 lightning, and shoves it in Cassidy's face. Cassidy freez gritting his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Is...that supposed to scare me or somethin’? ‘Cause believe me, it wouldn't be the first time I got shot through the head.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: It'd be the first time you didn't get up again. (pause) Saint of Killers is what they call me, boy. That name mean anything to you? Cassidy is sweating now, really scared. Clearly, he's hea the name.

dialogues.speaker: . SAINT
dialogues.text: I thought it might. Fella don't get as old as you have without hearin’ my name whispered. I left this world in eighteen eighty-six an' went to Hell for all the lives I'd taken, an' when I got there I just went right on killin’. Hell's supposed to knock the hate from a sinner’s soul, but all it did for mine was burn it blacker. I butchered my way across Perdition an’ damn near emptied it of souls, except the Lord Himself came down an' begged for me to stop. Even offered me a job. Wanted me to take over from the goddamned Angel of Death, who it turned out had no stomach for an eternity of killin’. He presses the gun into Cassidy's chin, tilts his head ba Cassidy is shitting himself, too terrified to move.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: But I did. So the Angel of Death gave up his sword, an’ forged me this pair of Colt revolvers from the steel. You know who I am, boy. You want to take the risk this gun won't work on you? He cocks the pistol. Cassidy freezes. A long moment passe Then Cassidy crumples, breaking down.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: No... The Saint keeps the pistol on him, nods at a phone on the bar. Cassidy shakily backs towards it, never taking his e off the pistol. He picks it up, sweats.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: There was a motel just down the road from where I left him. He didn't have any transport, okay? So if I can get the number for the motel- Another shove from the Saint, pistol to the nose. Cassidy is utterly miserable, wretched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Tulip are halfway through getting dressed when phone rings. They look at it, then at each other, nonplussed. Jesse picks up the phone, wary.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Yeah...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy on the phone, terrified, with the Saint's pistol stuck in his face.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Jesse! Thank fuck! Jesse, it’s me-

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (over phone) Cassidy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither Jesse nor Tulip can believe it.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you-

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (over phone) Jesse, listen: I've got 4 message I (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: have to give to you. I ~ I haven't got any choice- INT. TRUCKSTOP BAR - NIGHT 1ig The Saint pushes his gun right into Cassidy's face, twist it weirdly. He freezes, then goes on.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You have to go back to Annville. You'll get all the answers you're lookin’ for there. The Saint relaxes, takes his gun off Cassidy - who freaks little and seizes his chance.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Jesse, it's a trap! Don't fuckin’ go! It’s that guy, it's the fuckin' Saint of Killers-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse grimaces as a massive bang sounds on the line. He turns to look at Tulip, both of them pretty freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy lies on the floor, staring up at the ceiling, ama Slowly he raises his head, looks down at his body. A massive hole has been blasted in his gut, blood pouring from it to pool around him. A shadow falls over him. It's the Saint, of course, holding his smoking pistol. ’ CASSIDY (weak) He won't come now, you bastard. You're fucked.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: He'll come. He's burnin’ up, wantin’ to know what it is that's happened to him. Don't you get any high ideas about havin‘ him saved, boy. (pause) You sold him out.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cassidy's face falls, miserable. The Saint cocks his pistol, points it right down at us.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: You're just an animal thinks it's a man.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (yelling) No! The pistol roars and the screen goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse exits, tucking his shirt in. Grim sense of resolve. Tulip hurries after him, wary.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: “Saint of Killers"? There's only one guy that can be...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: And you're still going to Annville?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. He stops at a battered pick-up, reaches through the half- window to unlock the door, flips down the sunshade, catch the keys as they fall.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Nice to see folks ain't gettin' any smarter.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: I’m coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What? Now hold on there, honey-

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Hold on hell. I held on for three fucking years, wondering where you'd gone and why you didn't love me anymore. Now I know you never stopped I'm not gonna waste a single

dialogues.speaker: TULIP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: second I've got with you. I'm with you all the way, Custer. (pause) Until the end of the world.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: { impressed) Goddamn, girl. That just might be where we're headed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rattler has long since closed up, all lights off. Hug Root prowls the parking lot, scowling at the bar, the gro the desert - as if by giving the world a dirty look he'll the answers he wants. His cruiser is parked nearby. He ru at some dried blood on the ground with the toe of his boo then glares offshot, attention caught. Looking past him w see the MOTEL sign, way off down the road.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Well, well. Game's a-fuckin'~foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dingy little office, with a dumb-looking night clerk immersed in a porno mag; the latest issue of ANAL RAMPAGE Judging by his intense concentration, the big words are giving him trouble. He looks slowly up as Hugo strides in

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: You there, nosepick. You seen anyone lookin’ kinda unusual comin' in here?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (after a pause) Well, what would you mean by unusual?

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: I mean not normal, you asshole. Different.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (another pause) Well, could you maybe be more specific?

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: What is it with you? You got so many colourful folks stayin’ here, you need me to narrow it down? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: If you could.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: I swear, you musta leaked out of a hole in a goddamn prophylactic. Specifically: I’m lookin' for an ugly fella wearin' sunglasses, a stringy beanpole sort've a bitch an' an asshole dressed up like a Preacher. Ring any fuckin' belis?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (pause) As @ matter of fact, it does. A Mr. an' Mrs. Smith checked in here about two hours back. ‘Cept when they left, Mr. Smith had a Reverend's collar on. An' I guess Mrs. Smith was kinda on the skinny side.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Fucked if it ain't them. When'd they check out? They say where they were headed?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (after a good think) You just missed ‘em...uh...what was the other question?

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: (pained) Did they say where they were goin'?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Heard something about Annville. You know, that's been on TV all day? They in a lot of trouble, then? The Smiths?

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Well Smith ain't their real name, you fuckin' mongoloid!

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Hey, I know who you are! You're Sheriff Root, with the son's got a face like a puckered-up asshole! Jesus, livin' with a freak like that must be one long endless fuckin' nightmare- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 2 Hugo turns and smashes him across the face, K.O.ing him instantly. He goes down like a heap.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: (fuming) I am Sheriff Hugo Root, the man who took down a renegade Preacher and shot a worthless by~the-Jesus cop killer full of fuckin' holes and blew open a goddamned Washington conspiracy so big it makes Watergate look like a damp bloodfart. You will hear my name again, you worthless son of a bitch. He turns and stomps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeker and Dinnings freeze as they hear...

dialogues.speaker: HUGO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (over radio) This here is Hugo Root. All units in eo the vicinity to converge on Annville. I repeat, all units make your way to Annville immediately. This thing is goin' down an' that's the town it's gonna happen in. Get me tactical. Abandon the roadblocks. Get everybody out an' get ‘em over there: now.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruiser skids through a 180, then roars off in the direction it came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugo hangs up the radio, glares out over the wheel at the night beyond. Full of curdling, evil hatred, a man anticipating his chance to wreak cruel, violent revenge o the world,  129 130 131 132 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulip checks her pistol, then puts it back on her purse, turns to look warily at Jesse. He sits well back, eyes locked on the road. Whatever else he's feeling, he isn't scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck races on down the road ‘til all we see are its lights.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, DESERT
dialogues.text: At first all we see is pitch black night - then the Saint strides out of it, cold as ice. He passes us without a glance, and we're left with nothing but night again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. The TEN-TEN sign flickers, then goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy lies on the floor, shattered, apparently dead. Th hole in his guts has been matched by another in his chest meaty crater with blood, gore and bits of rib hanging out right where his heart used to be. Mouth wide open. We move closer until his face fills the shot. No movement Then, very slowly, his jaw shifts a little.

dialogues.speaker: CASSTDY
dialogues.text: Uh...? He grits his teeth as he realizes what's up.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (weak) Aw no. (pause) I'm sorry, Jesse. I just didn't have the balls. An’ there’s nothing I can do... His head slumps to the side, beaten.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We look at him past the edge of the vast lake of blood fr the Saint's earlier victims. It's gotten pretty dark and gooey now. He notices it, face slowly twisting as he thinks.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Oh fuck. Oh fuckin’ Jesus. He stares at the ceiling again, miserable, a little revol

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Why me? Steeling himself for the effort, he grits his teeth and r slowly over to his belly, grabbing for purchase with a ve weak arm. He yells in agony. Then, gasping and sweating with the pain and exertion, he raises his head to look at the lake of gore and shattered bodies...and we fade to black. We fade back in on a smear of ribs, guts and blood on the floor of the bar. We move along it as it becomes a trail, ending in Cassidy - he's hauled himself along the floor a is now lapping hungrily at the lake of blood on the floor He raises his head, dribbles gooey blood everywhere, look weakly at the various bodies. He's gasping.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Sorry, folks. Cassidy goes back to slurping up the blood, panting as he tries to breath and drink at the same time. He gets more more frenzied, guzzling the stuff faster and faster, unti throws his head back and gasps out a long sigh of satisfaction. Smeared with dark red blood, hair matted wi it, he locks like hell. He gets slowly to his feet, staggers a bit, catches himse on the bar. He wipes his mouth, still out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Better'n' fuckin' spinach. Then he turns and staggers towards the door, shaky, nowhe near at full strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flurry of activity. Cruisers are arriving from all over lights flashing. Cops, deputies, state troopers, even SWA

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: guys run to and fro, taking cover behind cars, houses, anywhere they can find. Citizens are bundled from their homes, escorted to safety behind the various buildings. M prepping of weapons. Annville is being turned into a gian trap.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (over bullhorn) All civilians are to be evacuated, I vepeat, evacuated to a place of safety. Please go with the officers, folks. We're expectin’ some bad guys here tonight, an' we don't want you people gettin' hurt in the shootin’. A harassed looking sheriff stands behind a cruiser that's been parked across the middle of the street. Deputies aim M16s acress the hood and trunk. A third deputy confers wi the sheriff. All around them, the preparations continue.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (over bullhorn) Come on now, shake the lead out! I don’t know how much time we got, but let's make sure we're ready for these sons of bitches! {aside, to deputy) What?!

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Still can’t raise Hugo Root, boss.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Goddamnit, where the hell is he? He started this damn thing - least he could do is show up to tell us who the hell to shoot at!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeker is on the radio, pissed off. Dinnings looks sceptical,

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Well where the hell is he, then?

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: {over radio) Sheriff Root's not responding, Sheriff Meeker. We think he's gone off the air. Meeker angrily dumps the radio on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Gone off the air, that crazy fucker's gone off the goddamned planet. This is exactly the bloodbath he's been waitin’ for - this is his revenge on the rest of us for havin' normal lives...

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: What d'you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: That fuckin' Hugo. I swear, just ‘cause he's got a son looks like Frankenstein an’ a two-inch pecker, he's gotta take it out on the whole goddamned world.

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: A two-inch-

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: {regretting it) I used to fuck his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quieter now. The lawmen have taken up positions behind th ears, in the storefronts, along the tops of the building. Nearly fifty guys, lots of firepower. The sheriff and three deputies still wait behind the car the middle of the street. The sheriff has a pistol in one hand, the builhorn in the other.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Nothin’. An’ still no sign of Hugo, Looking past them, we can see right down the main street out into the desert night beyond. Pretty quiet, but very tense.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (turning) Shit. Hand me out that goddamned radio-

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: (over radio) I think we got somethin'!  137 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sudden agitation among the cops as they cock their guns, ready to open up. All very tense. The sheriff's eyes narrow, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... The Saint enters town, walking up the middle of the main street. He doesn't bother to even look at the cops. The sheriff snaps out of it, grabs the bullhorn. The depu beside him is shaky as hell.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: That's the son of a bitch off the A.P.B. The fuckin' cop killer. (over bullhorn) You hold it right there, you asshole. We're gonna give you one chance to give yourself up- The Saint draws and fires once, fast as lightning, still moving coolly ahead. No emotion. The bullet smashes into the side cf the Sheriff's car, blowing a hole in the pan just above the gas ‘tank.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Fuck- Barely an instant later the car explodes in a flaring bla the bodywork separating and flying high into the air, the wheels shooting out to the side. The lawmen disappear in explosion. ’ Then there's a dull thud as half the Sheriff's blackened torso and head land in the dirt. That does it. All the cops in town open fire at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugo's cruiser skids to a stop, the fireball from the exploding car in town reflected in its windscreen. Multip

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: gunshots are heard. Hugo exits the car, staring at us, freaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops are giving it maximum: revolvers, automatics, Ml scope rifles, shotguns, even a few SMGs the SWAT boys bro along. We move along the street from group to group - deputies behind cars, marksmen on the rooftops. Dozens up dozens of shell casings rattle down on the street. Most of this actually misses the Saint, ploughing up the ground around him, kicking dust high into the air. Enough hitting him to stagger him, knock him back. At one point almost disappears in gunsmoke. Then he brings both pistol up and fires. One of the SWAT marksmen is hit, his head exploding all o his startled comrades. The second bullet ploughs into a shotgun held by a deputy the weapon's shells detonate, blowing the gun apart in hi hands. He and the four guys around him are shredded by buckshot, very messy. The cops pause for a second, staring. The Saint, of course, is still standing. He waits a secon then fires again. One cop is flung backwards off a rooftop, great are of bl flying up. Another is smashed through a storefront window in a spray shattered glass. Several cops resume firing, but most can only stare. The Saint is hit repeatedly, even as he returns fire. More cops fire back at him, but several more break and ru like hell. One deputy cowers in a cruiser, squealing into the radio. winces as another guy's bloody corpse is smashed against car.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Sheriff Root, please respond! Sheriff Root, we have your suspect in sight! (screaming) He's fucking killing every one of us! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A gunshot ~ then the window beside him shatters and the windows nearer us are instantly painted dark red with blo The car rocks on its suspension, The Saint continues his advance, now a bit ragged - missi chunks of meat from his chest, holes in his hat and cloth but still just grim, unworried. He ceases fire, then poin one gun off to the side without bothering to look. He's level with the town gas station, level with one of t pumps. He fires. The bullet smacks into one of the pumps. Several cops stare in amazement, riveted. He cocks the gun, fires again, still not stopping, still aiming, walking right at us. The bullet sparks against the pump, igniting the rushing gasoline. He cocks the gun again. The cops gape. A couple run, but most are transfixed. The Saint's eyes are full of hate, total commitment, not wavering for an instant. The gun in his hand, firing. The pump explodes. Pull way back as, seconds later, the whole gas station go up teo. A vast, flaring explosion of burning fuel. The Saint is glimpsed for a second, then the explosion reache out and he disappears in the flames. The cops stare, faces lit by the flames. They they start to break and run. Behind them, the fireba rises higher, white and orange, flaring. Blazing fire beg to rain down on the running cops. Shouts and screams. The buildings are hit too, catching fire. Several cops run around on fire, screaming in horror, dyi in agony. The Saint appears out of the fire, a silhouette at first. He's one fire himself, back and shoulders burning. He resumes firing, cutting down cops as they run. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He walks right towards us, and we can see his expression still unchanged, as if nothing has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battered pick-up pulls out and Jesse and Tulip exit, gaping at the burning town. Distant screams and gunshots be made out.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: You think it's him?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It's his M.Q. View from behind them, with Annville burning away. Then we move in fast on Jesse. At the last second he star to turn - and is smashed in the head with a 45 automatic. grunts and drops like a stone. It's Hugo.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Say hello to justice, you godfearin' fuck. Tulip freaks and goes for her pistol, but only has it hal way out of her purse when Hugo leans across the top of th truck and points his gun in her face. HUGO . Go on an’ take it outta there, whore. Put it on the truck an' back away. Slowly, She complies, very wary, totally aware of the delicacy of situation.

dialogues.speaker: , HUGO
dialogues.text: That's a good little beave. He knocks her pistol off the truck ~ on his side. His fac twists, mean.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Looks like I got me one of these weird fuckin' by-the-Jesus F.B.I. cocksuckers. Reckon I'll take a walk into town an’ fetch out the other one. (taking out handcuffs) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HUGO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But first I want you in irons, you scrawny little bitch.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: (scared but determined) Fuck yout Hugo is about te move for her when Jesse raises his head, gritting his teeth, the cut on his temple bleeding nastil Hugo notices.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch-

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Goddamn. He puts his boot on Jesse's head and stomps him face firs into the dirt. Jesse grunts, lies still.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: You just lay there, boy. Don't want you givin' any more crazy fuckin‘ orders. He turns back to Tulip, only to find she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Shit! He searches the area, peering into the night ~ then relax Tulip is running hell for leather towards Annville, unfortunately silhouetted against the flames. Hugo smiles nastily, takes careful aim.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: Shoulda done like Daddy told you, eunt- He suddenly screams in agony, a high~pitched shriek, and gun goes off into the sky with a huge bang. Then he drops it. Jesse, still on the ground, is grimacing hatefully and clutching Hugo by the balls, squeezing for all he's worth Hugo keeps screaming.  140 141 142 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulip reaches the outskirts of town, still a bit freaked trying to catch her breath after her mad dash to get away from Hugo. She turns the corner into the main street, to be greeted scene of blazing destruction. The buildings are on fire, street is littered with corpses. Her eyes narrow as she peers into the distance. Down at the other end of the street, we can just make out Saint finishing off the last of the cops. One guy falls t his knees. The Saint puts his pistol to the guy's head. Tulip's eyes widen. The gun roars and the guy falls back dead, all in silhoue Tulip dodges back round the corner, flattens herself agai the wall, freaked.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Oh Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugo is flipped right round on the end of Jesse’s right h grunts with pain. A bad beating follows. Jesse punches Hugo five times in t face to knock him back, once in the gut to bend him over, knees him in the face to snap his head back and then hook hard left into his chin to send him flying back against t truck. All this in slightly over ten seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulip grimaces as more gunshots sound from offshot. She risks a peek round the corner again. No sign of the Saint. Just the fire and the scattered bodies. Her eyes narrow. Lots of guns on the street too, holstered or otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: * Tulip hesitates, then steels herself and scurries out o the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugo's pulped face comes through the truck window at us i spray of broken glass. Jesse hauls him back out again, snarls hatefully into his face. Hugo barely knows what planet he's on.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You watch your goddamned mouth when you talk about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lit by the flickering flames, Tulip moves from body to bo collecting guns. She stuffs two automatics down the back her jeans, shoves a revolver into her jacket, another automatic in the front of her jeans. She's just picking up a gleaming silver 357 magnum when s stops, realizing the shooting and screaming have stopped. e All she can hear are the flames. She looks up. The Saint stands watching her, pistols holstered, emotionless. Maybe twenty feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugo is still conscious, just about, spitting blood, gasp hate. Jesse holds him up by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: I know what you are, you son of a bitch...You're a goddamned Washington secret fuckin’ weapon...they grew you in some kinda genetic by-the-Jesus laboratory...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talkin’ about? Behind his back, Hugo's hand fumbles in his belt, pulls something out. His face twists, hateful. e sco You little bastard.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A switchblade snaps open in Hugo's hand.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO
dialogues.text: I got your ass. Jesse's face goes dangerously cold. His eyes slowly narro

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (word of God) Fuck yourself. Hugo's eyes bulge in horror and terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulip stands facing the Saint. He hasn't moved yet. The last gun she picked up is not immediately visible. The Saint watches her, calm. Tulip's eyes are wide. She clamps her mouth shut, fights panic.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: You're the Preacher's woman, ain’t you? I guess that means he made the party. You call him on in here an’ we'll have an end to this.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: What...what are you going to do-to him...?

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: What I do. Tulip freezes - then the fear leaves her face. Cold fury takes over. She brings the 357 up at us, fires. The bullet smashes into the Saint's eyeball, which bursts a spray of blood and jelly. He clamps a hand to it, stagg round - and roars a hateful yell of fury and pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse runs like hell for Annville, anxious.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Tulip! Jesus fuckin' Christ! Tulip?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then more gunshots sound from the town. Jesse doubles his pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulip advances on the Saint, blasting away with revolver automatic, the 357 now discarded. He's bent over, stagger along the street, hands to his face. Blood pours out betw the fingers. Each bullet knocks him a step further, and Tulip is really pouring it on. A wild scene - lit by the fires, the diminutive girl shooting the hell out of the g gunfighter. The guns in her hands click as they run out. She drops th and smoothly pulls the two automatics from the back of he jeans, resumes firing. The Saint's hat flies off. Bullets smack into his head an shoulders. Tulip's face is set - scared, but refusing to panic. Tota determination. She keeps firing. The Saint goes down on one knee, struck repeatedly in the head. He holds one hand up as if to stop her. A bullet punches through it. One hand still over his eye he roars again. Tulip keeps firing, grits her teeth. The Saint is holding himself up with his ruined hand. Tulip keeps firing. There's a click as one of the guns lo dry. She drops it, takes careful aim with the other, fire The Saint starts to crumple. Tulip fires again. The Saint falls. The gun locks dry with a loud click. The Saint catches himself. Horrified, Tulip lowers the useless gun. The Saint takes a moment, breathes deep. Then he slowly cises from the half crouch she forced him into, turns to her. Tulip can only stare, petrified. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Saint takes the hand away from his face, revealing th butchered, dripping, empty eye socket. Tulip is ready to faint. The Saint grimaces, then roars again.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: Preacher!!! Jesse charges round the corner into the main street and s dead, staring in horror. The Saint has one of his pistols pressed against Tulip's head. His lip curls, surly. Tulip is frozen. Both are looking at Jesse. He freaks.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Tulip-!

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: (cocking the gun) Not one more word or she goes to meet her maker. You're a dead man, but she can still get out of this alive. Jesse clamps his mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: Now you come on in here, Preacher.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Jesse, don't! Get out of here! Run! Jesse walks forward ‘til he's about ten feet from the Sai

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (quiet) Never again, baby. She stares at him, horrified. The Saint turns the gun on Jesse, takes aim. Tulip freaks

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: You can't just kill him! You said he could find the answers here! He's got a right to know what the hell it is that happened to him! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Saint looks at her, thoughtful. Then his expression hardens. And he looks at Jesse again. Jesse returns his glare, unafraid.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: I ain't got no answers. I don't know why he's the one that's got to die. I don't know why that damn thing chose him out of all the millions that it could've. The ones who sent me, they're the ones who know. You want answers, Preacher? Ask the Angels. (indicating the gun} All I got is this.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: (breaking down) It isn't fair! I love him, and you're just gonna shoot him in the street! You rotten son of a Ditch, you've got a fucking gun! The Saint's eyes narrow, mildly irritated.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: .«..Come to that, he has his goddamned power. He coulda told me to blow my own head off, or just keep waixin’ ‘til I reached the moon, or anything he damn well pleased. Just so happened I was quicker. Jesse thinks hard. The Saint glares back at him, a challenging look, like: W Jesse comes to a decision, nods slowly. Then, keeping his eyes locked on the Saint's, he takes his jacket off, loos his collar. Tulip's eyes pop. The Saint nods, grim.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: Makes no odds to me how you die, boy. But you got some sand, I will say that.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse glances sadly at her, then rolls up his sleeves.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: Know this, Preacher: I see your lips twitch - I hear one single syllable of a Single word ~ we're gonna find out if you can talk faster’n I can pull the pistol. The Saint nods to Tulip.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: An' I guarantee you’ll go to Hell knowin' she's left here with me. Jesse nods again, spits on his hands, grimaces angrily an wades right in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeker peers into the rear view, squinting.

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: How far to Annville?

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Five minutes at most...who the hell is that? A pair of headlights fill the rear-view with flaring ligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tulip's pick-up comes roaring up behind the cruiser, weav to overtake. INT. TULIP'S PICK-UP - NIGHT isl Cassidy spits blood, snarls angrily as he drives. He drip blood everywhere. Very pale.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Get out've the fuckin' way, you bollocks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeker snarls as the pick-up draws alongside. He weaves t block its path. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Crazy son of a bitch! They get a glimpse of Cassidy, yelling angrily at them, gesturing for them to clear the way.

dialogues.speaker: DINNINGS
dialogues.text: Wants us to let him through!

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: Fuck him. (pointing to side of the road) Pull over, you asshole! Pull over now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy sneers, jerks the wheel hard over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pick-up smashes hard into the cruiser, knocking it cl off the road. It spins a couple of times, careers onwards 185 INT. MEEKER‘'S CRUISER - NIGHT 155 Dinnings hangs on for dear life as Meeker struggles desperately to regain control of the cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruiser crashes into a creek bed, turning on its side it slides along, then smashing into a rocky outcrop and stopping. The wheels spin, the engine howls. Then silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess this one's all Hugo's...

dialogues.speaker: MEEKER
dialogues.text: He fuckin' deserves it.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Hold on, Jesse! The Cavalry's comin’!  158 159

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Tne pick-up races on down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse crashes to the ground with sickening force. The Sai who just hit him, is standing a good twenty feet away. Tulip watches, horrified. Jesse gets to his feet as his opponent advances, just in to punch the Saint in the jaw. No effect. Another one. No effect. A fast combination: right, left, right, left, rig to the guts, left to the guts, haymaker across the face. effect. The Saint backhands him across the face, smashes against a burning police cruiser. Jesse staggers, spits blood, stays on his feet. They face each other for a moment, Jesse hateful and defi the Saint just grim. The Saint comes at him again. Jesse gets in a couple of (useless) punches, then dodges just in time and the Saint punches his fist through the cruiser'’s roof. Jesse karate chops him in the throat, rolls backwards acr the car's hood, kicking the Saint in the face as he goes. The Saint is actually staggered a bit. Jesse lands on is feet, weaves in again. : He runs right into the Saint's hand, which clamps down on hair, yanking his head back. The Saint then hauls him rig rough and sends him flying through a picket fence, shatte the boards. Jesse crawls in the wreckage of the fence, trying to get together. The Saint is coming up behind.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Jesse! Just as the Saint bends down to seize hold of him, Jesse whips round and bashes the bastard across the face with a length of two-by-four from the fence. The Saint stands upright. Jesse squints up at him. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Saint stands with the board hanging bizarrely from hi cheek with no visible means of support for it. It's just there. Totally unperturbed, he takes hold of the board wi no more effort than if he were brushing off a fly. He loo right at us. Jesse stares, grimacing. The Saint pulls the board away from his face and we see w was holding it there: two four-inch nails, now oozing red blood as they leave the wounds. Still cool as you like, t Saint drops the board to the side.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: Kinda different. Then his face darkens and he seizes Jesse, hauls him up, starts slapping the shit out of him. Jesse takes about si backhanders, spits blood all over the place. The Saint flings him backwards and he crashes to the grou a wreck. He lies still for a moment. Tulip's face falls, distraught. This looks like it. The Saint sneers a little, pulls his coat back from his holster, prepares to draw. Then Jesse gets up. Very slowly. Spits out a tooth. Faces the Saint. Smiles darkly. . Even the Saint is a bit surprised, but only for a second. Then his face darkens again, and they close for more. Tulip is amazed, then remembers -

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Go for his eyes! Jesse ducks a huge haymaker, then stabs upwards with midd and index fingers, jams them right into the Saint's gory, ruined eye socket. The Saint roars in agony, thrashes wildly, but Jesse keeps the fingers in there and twists a grinds like mad, putting all the strength he's got into i The Saint, furious, grabs Jesse's arm and slowly pulls th fingers from his eye. Jesse strains like mad, but the Sai is too strong. Then the Saint decks him with a horribly hard right and J hits the ground unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Silence for a minute. Tulip is so appalled she looks read to be sick. The Saint looks down at Jesse. Then he begins drawing his gun.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: Wasn't worth it, boy. Never woulda made a goddamn bit of difference. Suddenly the little tableau is flooded with light. The Saint turns to see a pair of headlights bearing down him. It turns out to be a rapidly closing pick-up truck, engine roaring. The Saint's eyes narrow. Tulip stares, Jesse raises his head to look, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy braces himself, grits his teeth, furious.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You! EXT. ANNVILLE MAIN STREET - NIGHT ié6l Harshly lit by the headlights, the Saint grimaces angrily plants his feet hard on the ground, throws his shoulders and braces himself for the impact (Jesse should not be ly in the truck's path, of course). The Saint fumes and hates, totally unafraid. INT. TULIP‘'S PICK-UP TRUCK ~ NIGHT 162

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (screaming like a madman) Yer Ma’s a Hooer!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massive impact, huge crunch as the pick-up ploughs into t Saint of Killers, stops dead as it hits him, and Cassidy flung through the windscreen and past the Saint in a spra flying glass. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He sails through the air. A moment's silence. Tulip's gaze follows the arc of his fall. He crashes to the ground in a horribly hard impact, ploug up the dirt. Yells in agony, then goes silent. Jesse turns painfully towards him. Cassidy raises his head, turns towards Jesse with a face of broken glass. Smiles weakly.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You're rescued. Jesse's eyes widen. Then he slowly turns back to the Sain Tulip turns to look that way too. The truck has rolled back a couple of feet, a wreck. Both wheels have come off at the front. The engine block and panels are bent up off the chassis. The hood is gone. The windscreen is shattered. Steam hisses from the engine. A large, foot-deep dent is dug into the fender and grille - engine itself has bent around the impact. The Saint stands unmoved, rock solid, staring at us with pissed-off glare. The hood of the truck is embedded in hi stomach. He takes a couple of deep breaths, yanks the hoo from his guts and flings it away. His face sets hard in a grimace of pure hatred,

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: Right. He starts to draw his pistol. Jesse's hand whips past the Saint's coat from behind, dra the second pistol. The Saint turns, furious and amazed, and freezes. The battered Jesse stands glaring at him, presses the second pistol into the Saint's throat, pushes his head back. The Saint has drawn the first gun, but it's obvious he'll never bring it up in time. He can't believe this is happening, furious at Jesse and himself.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You drew first.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pissed off, battered, but full of savage triumph, Jesse c the pistol with a loud click, The Saint's eyes widen, furious.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: T didn't say a goddamned word. He fires and blows the Saint's brains clean out through t top of his head. The Saint staggers back. Jesse watches, eyes narrowed, grim. The Saint glares back, top of his head gone. We can see through the empty eye socket and out the back of his head He's as grim and mean as ever.

dialogues.speaker: SAINT
dialogues.text: The hell with you. Then he drops to his knees and falls dead at Jesse's feet Jesse turns away, drops the pistol, starts walking toward us. Tulip grabs him and the two embrace, holding each other a tight as they can for a long moment. They kiss. Eventuall Tulip breaks it, stares up at him in amazement. Jesse gri back.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: You're crazy. You're totally fucking crazy. He could have ripped you in half.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Well...there were a couple of times, I gotta admit, he maybe had me a . Little worried.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: (grinning) come here! They kiss again, against the blazing inferno that used to Annville. Cassidy is trying to get up, but is so weak he's only man to get as far as his hands and knees. He struggles, but seems beaten. Then he realizes that someone is holding a hand out to him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's Jesse. He stands with his hand out, serious. Tulip stands behind him, watching Cassidy warily. Cassidy looks at the hand, not sure what to make of it. T he tentatively takes the hand and Jesse pulls him to his feet. He stands, rather unsteady. Jesse glances over Cassidy's hideous wounds. The two men face each other.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What I said to you, back at the bar. I was wrong. I apologize.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Jesse...I'm the one should be apologizin'. I sold you out. I nearly got you killed.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: But you set things right. Cassidy is quietly stunned. Then he reaches out his hand. Jesse takes it and they shake. Tulip is leaning on Jesse's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: I still think you're a prick. They both turn to her.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: (smiling) But a nice prick. They both grin. All three turn to survey the destruction. Annville is on fire from one end to the other, and the street is littere with dead cops.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Jesus. Quite a party, eh?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Quite a party.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: At least you got that bastard, The Saint's body lies in the street.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse's eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: No... Tulip is curious.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: No I didn't. They're both curious as Jesse thinks to himself.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It wasn't him that caused this. He was just a goddamned errand boy.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: He said it was the ones who sent him, remember? He said if you want answers.,.ask the Angels. He turns and yells angrily into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: You bunch of assholes! You get your asses down here now! You got a lot of shit to answer for! Tulip and Cassidy look at each other, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It was you did this to me! You let that murderin' son of a bitch loose to hunt me down! You're the ones caused all this fuckin’ slaughter! (quieter, fuming) You, know what I can do with this goddamned power I got. You motherfuckers start talkin’ to me now - Or you won’t believe the shit that T'll do next. Sudden silence. The flames die away. Then the whole place is bathed in incredible, otherworldy white light. Tulip and Cassidy cover their eyes, but Jesse stares righ into the light. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A huge figure forms above the town, a beautiful angel tha glows with golden light, wings spread wide. It spreads ou its arms, raises its face to the sky. Tulip and Cassidy are freaked. Jesse just looks suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Then behold, O mortals: the glory of the heavenly host. Jesse iS not remotely impressed. He lights a cigarette, flips the Zippo shut, looks up again.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Cut the shit. The radiance fades. The angel figure disappears. Standing in front of Jesse is a slim-featured guy in a white suit real-life ANGEL, He looks a bit uncomfortable, like a P.R guy who hasn't done his homework.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Er... Tulip and Cassidy are totally freaked. Jesse sneers a bit

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I am an Angel of the Lord,

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Then you got a lot of explainin' to do. May as well get started. {word of God) An’ don't you leave out a fuckin' word. {back to normal) Now what the hell is it that's happened to me?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: It's something that should never have existed. It was born when an angel, a brother of mine, fell in love with a demon-bitch from Hell...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I saw that part.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Nothing like it has ever happened before. There is a war raging in the realms beyond your world. One side Heaven ~ on the other, Hell.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Which ain't necessarily the same as good an’ evil, right?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: (awkward) ++.That war must never end. Angels and demons should never meet in anything but battle. And yet it happened anyway. We caught the lovers not long after the birth, and had the Saint of Killers gun them down - but their offspring proved quite indestructible. He keeps talking, face now melted into a shot of the roll silver clouds of Heaven as seen in Jesse's mirror vision.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: We shut it away in a corner of Heaven. It was neither good nor evil. It was something new, a combination of them both. We called it Genesis. Now he's melted into a series of previous scénes - Genesi ripping through Earth's atmosphere, hitting the Annville church, possessing Jesse, destroying the congregation.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: It had no intelligence beyond a basic sentience. It escaped from Heaven, seeking a host - someone who could acton its behalf, who could use its power...someone who could speak for it. He looks pointedly at Jesse, who's deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: What does it want?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: It does not want. It is what happens when good meets evil. It is an idea. It is a power for you to decide what to do with. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: An’ why me, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: That I don't know. Had you done anything that might attract it? Jesse thinks about it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashback to Jesse screaming at his congregation.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Give me a sign! Give me some incontrovertible proof that the Almighty ain't got His head shoved firmly up His ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse considers.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Might have done.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: It needed a home, that was all. But now, listen to me. And understand. We cannot let a power as strong’as this run loose on Earth. We must return the entity to Heaven, and lock it in the dark forever. Submit to us - let us sever its bond with your soul - and you may go in peace.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: The. fuck I will.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: (panicky) You don't know what you're saying! I promise you that you'll go free! I give you my word!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Your word ain't worth dogshit on a hot afternoon. You set the Saint of Killers on me, an’ now he's fucked up you think I'm just gonna give myself up like nothin’ happened? Fuck (MORE) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jesse, Tulip 110. 165

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: you...No, I think there's more to this that you ain't sayin’. Like how come God allowed this to happen, a thing bein' born that never shoulda? How come he didn't stop it himself?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: {on his knees, terrified) Oh not Oh please don't make me tell! I'll be destroyed for this! In Jesus's name, have mercy!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Every. Last. Word.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: (breaking down) The Lord God is gone. and Cassidy freeze. A moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Ain't quite the answer I expected. What the fuck do you mean, he's gone?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: I mean he quit. When Genesis was born he left his throne in Heaven. He said he would go and live among the mortals. Here on earth.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: How can God quit? How can the world keep goin'?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I dunno, I haven't noticed that much difference. Maybe we just don't need the fucker. Jesse thinks about that, turns back to the shaky-looking angel, shrewdly raises an eye - Well?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Humanity was not supposed to know...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Well they're gonna find out pretty fucking guickly, believe me. I'm gomna see to it,

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: {perking up) But how will you tell them? Why (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fll.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: should his flock believe he has deserted them? Why should the atheists believe he is gone, when they never believed he was there in the first place? How do you convince people that you're telling the truth? (pressing his advantage) Remember the good folk of Annville...Reverend Custer...? Jesse is stumped for a minute. Then his eyes narrow again and a nasty smile appears on his face.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Why would he leave just when Genesis was born?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: (suddenly wary) What?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Unless he was scared of it?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: Ah - now-

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: It's as strong as he is, ain't it? Or maybe stronger? You said it yourself - it was somethin’ new. It gave me the power to be obeyed. If I found the Lord God Almighty, I could make him face the people of the world an' own up to runnin’ out on them. Right?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: (appalled) No! You can't! Think about what you, re saying! You can't give orders to God! You haven't got the right!

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I haven't got the what? Sudden silence. Jesse glares at the angel with steadily mounting anger.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I haven't got the right? Fuck you! I gave my life to God, just like my Daddy did before me. We never quit on him. We stuck by him an’ his Holy (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bible through thick an‘ thin, ao matter how shitty a hand we got dealt - an’ now you're tellin' me I ain't got the right to face him down an’ ask him what the fuck he thinks he's doin? (furious, losing it) Seems to me, asshole, that I got all the right in the goddamned world! Seems to me that every man an' woman on this planet has the right to say - Hey, Lord! You been fuckin' with us from day one! You been playin roulette with our fuckin' lives through ten thousand years of war, famine, death an’ fucked-up shit! So maybe you'd like to tell us, when you're finished movin’ in mysterious fuckin’ ways: (screaming) What the fuck do you mean by fuckin‘ quittin' on us?!! Silence for a moment. Tulip and Cassidy are very wary, waiting for whatever comes next. Jesse fumes, red-faced. The angel is shitting himself.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: The creation cannot make demands of the creator...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Then the creator shouldn't shit on his creation. You wanna know how I got the right to make demands of the Lord? It's ‘cause I got given the power of God. I know what it's like. But all I did with it was the right fuckin' thing.

dialogues.speaker: ' ANGEL
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I have had enough of you, ballsweat. You an’ your asshole pals in Heaven, you're responsible for this whole fuckin’ bloodbath. Well, I been thinkin': if there's a heaven, there has to be the other place as well, right? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL
dialogues.text: {incredibly edgy) Y...¥..-Yes...

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: {word of God) Then you can go there. The angel's eyes bulge in unbelievable horror. He opens h mouth to scream, then bursts into bright red, blazing fla A terrible, unearthly scream echoes around the place, so that our heroes have to clamp their hands to their ears - then it fades into the distance, as the if the screamer h fallen down a deep, deep hole until he's out of earshot. angel is reduced to ash, scattered on the breeze. Jesse looks grimly at it, then turns away. Cassidy looks him, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Nice bit've preachin’. (smiles } Preacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them walk towards the battered pick-up Jesse Tulip arrived in. Jesse and Cassidy move slowly, favourin their various wounds. No sign of Hugo Root.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Not long ‘til dawn. I'd really need to be gettin' me arse undercover.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Can't take the sun, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I'm @ fuckin’ vampire, Turnip...

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: Tulip.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: One inch of tan an’ I'll go up like the bleedin' fourth of July. You give us a lift down the road, aye?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Least I can do, partner. They get into the truck.  167 168 169 170 17. il4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's at the wheel, Tulip’s in the middle. Jesse starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You're really goin’ lookin' for God? We close up on Jesse, who looks grim and determined.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: If it takes me a goddamned Lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pick-up drives off.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: {smiling wearily) Generally, if he says he's gonna do something? He does it.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Just as a matter of interest, Jesse - is there anything that does scare you? Jesse smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Well, I ain't run into anything yet- Suddenly he freezes, stares, stamps on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pick-up screeches to a halt, rocking back on its chas INT. STOLEN PICK-UP - NIGHT _ 417i Tulip and Cassidy are flung back in their seats. Then the turn to gape at Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: TULIP
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But Jesse can only stare ahead, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Illuminated in the headlights, still astride his BMX, is Arseface. He's looking curiously back at the truck. Our heroes peer out at him, freaked beyond belief. The he pedals awkwardly up to Jesse's side of the pick-up truck and sticks his head in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three stare at Arseface, incredibly nervous. He's che as ever.

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: (Hullo!) Jesse recoils at the voice.

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: {Sorry to trouble you folks, but I was wondering if you'd seen my Dad around here anywhere?) The three of them look at each other, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: {His name's Hugo Root - he’s the Sheriff around these parts. Tall, dignified kind of a guy. I've been looking for him all night.)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (whisper, to Cassidy) What ’the fuck is he sayin’?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (starting to laugh, incredulous} Well what the fuck are you askin’ me for? Cassidy puts a hand to his mouth to hide his laughter. Th gets Tulip going. She leans back to try to hide behind Jesse, struggling not to howl with laughter. When Jesse turns back to Arseface he can barely contain himself, tee gritted, coughing over the occasional snigger. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Uh...come again? That almost puts Tulip and Cassidy over the edge. A herculean effort to stop themselves from laughing. Arsefa is oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: {I'm looking for my Dad, Hugo Root. He's a member of the law enforcement community. He looks a bit like Jimmy Stewart.)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, buddy. I can't understand a goddamned word you said. Arseface pulls a photo from his pocket, hands it in.

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: (My Dad, see? I'm looking for my Dad. That's him there, with me.) The photo shows Arseface and Hugo together - Arseface wit arm round his Dad, giving the thumbs up. Hugo looks impossibly bitter, fuming with hatred for the whole world

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: (See?) Jesse looks at the photo, and all becomes clear.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Aaaaaah...! He hands the photo to Tulip, raises an eye. Tulip and Cassidy stare at it, eyes popping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse leans out the window, hands the photo to Arseface, smiles reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Got you now, buddy. Yeah, I know who your Daddy is. Saw him tonight as a matter of fact.

dialogues.speaker: ARSEFACE
dialogues.text: (You did?) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: (very friendly, jerking thumb back) Sure I did. He's lyin’ back there with his dick up his ass. Jesse floors it, and the pick-up races off down the road cloud of dust, leaving Arseface staring after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy, back in the bar we met him in, right at the very start.- Nothing has changed. He frowns as he picks a rather obvious pubic hair out of beer. Then he snaps out of it, grins at us.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Told you, didn't I? Anything that could happen, fuckin' well did happen. {looking down, thoughtful smile) It's been a wee while now since I last saw Jesse an‘ Tulip. But y'know, I wouldn't be surprised if one of these days all that weird fuckin’ shite started up again. An' then maybe we'll min into each other again...I don't know whether or not I believe that God ran out on us. I don't know if he really is loose somewhere in the world. But I'll tell you this: if Jesse Custer ever does get his hands on the good Lord... (smiling darkly at us) The bastard better have a fuckin’ good excuse. (raising his beer to us before turning away) Cheers. And fade to black.
